Every day she is working in her fields, where she is constantly removing weeds that are growing to prevent the weeds from consuming the nutrients of her crops and thus obtain a good harvest. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful to receive financial support that helps her to move forward, and she promises to make her payments on time. This time she wishes to have 3,000 nuevos soles to buy agricultural land and thus increase production.

loans.use: to purchase land for farming

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodrigo, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua, es soltero sus ingresos como guarda de seguridad son destinado para apoyar los estudios de sus hijos  y a su madre. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en su hogar, desea cambiar el entechado el cual está en muy malas condiciones de habitar y con las lluvias es muy incomodo para la familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single and a resident of a marginalized neighborhood of Managua. The money that he earns as a security guard goes toward supporting his mother, and his children's education. 

He is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his home. He would like to change the roof which is in very bad shape and causes discomfort to the family when it rains.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheet metal and beams.

loans.name: Monja Blanca Lancetillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Concepcion es casada, de edad 53 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se decia a la agricultura a siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio porque su esposo le enseño el trabajo y hasta la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de cardamomo, desea en el futuro sembrar mas cardamomo pra obtener mejores ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia figuran 19 integrantes, pero, solamente a 13 e ellos se le concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
Concepcion is a married, 53 year old lady. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 2 children and they are both studying in school.  She makes her living growing cardamom. She started this business because her husband taught her the job. To date, she has 20 years of experience.

She organizes a group and she decided to apply for a loan that will be used to purchase supplies for the maintenance of cardamom. She hopes in the future to plant more cardamom in order to earn better profits. The other team members also make their living through the cultivation of cardamom. In the photo there are 19 people, but only 13 of them were granted the loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintenance of Cardamom

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es: Justiniano de 52 años de edad, es divorciado y tiene un hijo de 17 años con quien vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Justiniano se dedica a la agricultura y desarrolla su actividad con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar que constantemente realizan las actividades agrícolas correspondientes. Al iniciarse una nueva temporada de mantenimiento desea realizar la renovación de sus plantaciones de cacao por hallarse malogradas y sin la debida capacidad de seguir produciendo, es por ello que planea realizar la compra de plantas de almácigo para injertos y así desempeñar una mantenimiento técnico de sus árboles cacaoteros , realizando esta actividad dentro de las 3 hectáreas que posee, asimismo darle un mantenimiento integral a sus demás plantas con la contratación de trabajadores dedicados a este rubro. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y reemplazar los árboles de cacao que se encuentran malogrados con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Justiniano is 52 years old, is divorced, and has a 17 year old son who lives with him at his home constructed of wood. Justiniano makes his living in agriculture and operates with the help of workers from the area that are constantly performing agricultural activities. 

At the start of a new season of taking care of the land, he hopes to be able to replant his cocoa plantations by finding the unproductive plants which lack the ability to continue to produce.  This is why he plans to make the purchase of nursery plants for grafting and thus carry out a technical maintenance of his cocoa trees. He will be doing this activity on the 3 acres he owns as well as providing comprehensive maintenance to his other plants by hiring workers who have experience in this sector. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful to receive financial support that helps him to move forward, and he promises to make his payments on time. On this occasion he wishes to use 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase seedling plants and replace cocoa trees that are not producing with the help of workers from the area.

loans.use: to purchase nursery plants and replace unsuccessful plants.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 39 años de edad, viuda. Aprendió a cuidar ganado junto a su padre, al casarse siguió dedicando a la crianza y engorde de ganado con su esposo, cuando él murió no dejo de trabajar. Ella hoy en día ayuda a su papá. También, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado. Sus padres están ya bastante mayores y tiene que buscar formas de llevar ingresos a su familia.
Compra sus materiales e insumos en la ciudad y los traslada en bus hasta su casa que esta a 4km de donde vive. Para alimentar su ganado recoge residuos de cosecha de los cultivos de los vecinos (zacate de maíz, maicillo, tuza, entre otros para bajar costos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 terneros para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos a mejor precio a futuro.
Espera disponer de los recursos para invertir y poder tener un pequeño ingreso al venderlos en un futuro, todo esto aprovechando la época y la abundancia de pasto en el campo. Para que ella y su familia tengan acceso a mejores condiciones (alimentación, educación, salud…).
En un futuro sueño con disponer de un puesto de venta más grande y mas abastecido del que es propietaria en este momento.
texts.en:
Marta is a 39-year-old woman and a widow.  She learned to care for cattle alongside her father.  Upon marrying she continued working at raising and fattening cattle with her husband.  When he died she didn’t stop working and nowadays she helps her father.  She also works selling clothing.  She has a small sales stall in the market.  Her parents are fairly elderly and she has to look for ways to bring income to her family.  She buys her materials and supplies in the city that is about 4 kilometers from where she lives and moves them by bus to her house.  To feed her cattle she collects leftovers from the harvest of the neighbors' crops (corn and sorghum fodder and corn cobs among other things) to lower costs.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two calves in order to raise them, fatten them and sell them at a better price in the future.  She hopes to have the resources to invest in them and to be able to have a small income upon selling them in the future, taking advantage of the season and the abundance of grass in the field, so that she and her family have access to better conditions (food, education, health…).  

In the future she dreams of having a larger and better-stocked sales stall than the one she owns at this time.

loans.use: to buy two calves in order to raise, fatten and sell them at a better price in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an enclosing wall in front of her home

loans.name: Ma. Connie

texts.en:
Ma. Connie is 47 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Connie is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Ma. Connie has been farming sugarcane for nine years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, of saving enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en: Misbah is 31 years old, married and works from her home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for seven years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Misbah was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family so she felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So she applied for her third loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of threads in different colors. She dreams of expanding her business to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angeles is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angeles has been raising pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. Flora is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.  Flora is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, beverages, and soap. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and beverages

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a vigorous, 46-year-old lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years.  She stitches for the people of her community and she uses the income to support her entire family.  She has become famous by stitching stylish clothes according to fashion.  However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  

For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads of different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  This will create a means of increasing revenue so that she may generate a healthier source of income.  She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a vigorous, 43-year-old lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  

However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.  She wishes to provide a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Zubaria

texts.en:
Zubaria is a 23-year-old divorced woman.  Instead of burdening her family, she started her own tailoring business five years ago.  She is a very talented lady who has received a lot of appreciation from her community.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

To meet the demands of her customers consistently, she needs to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.  So she applied for her fourth loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and laces.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Nanyuki area of Kenya.  He is 53 years old, and married with four grown-up children.  He plants (i.e. tea-tree, vegetables, and fruits) and does dairy farming.  Farming is his sole economic activity, through which he earns income for his family.  

He knew Milango through friends and he now seeks a loan to buy timber and logs to construct a cattle shed.  He plans to supply milk to the whole town in five years’ time.  The major challenge for his business is drought and competition from other traders, which reduces his income.  He says he wants to be exporting milk to other countries in the future.  The income from the loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy timber and logs to construct a cattle shed.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 33-year-old lady who has been actively involved in clothing sales for three years.  She purchases a wide variety of embroidered and printed cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity.  She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community.  Parveen is also selling bangles to generate extra income.  

She requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, from Kashf Foundation, to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season (i.e. lawn and chiffon), taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.  In this way, she would be able to earn more income through more sales.  She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths of lawn and chiffon for the summer season.

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Floro is a married man and has 5 children. Floro has been engaged in the farming business for more than 12 years. This is the source of his income.
 
Floro is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Floro hopes to expand his business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 35-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue her business operations and to meet with increasing demand, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and lace. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and lace.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 62-year-old married woman. She has successfully been running a small business of milk sales for many years. She has 2 calves and 3 cows that she milks. She milks cows then sells their milk to many of her neighbours, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is trying hard to fulfill their demand for food, clothing and education. She has improved her business to meet the daily expenses of life. To further improve her business she has requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes for an increase in the production capacity of milk which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Toxiflor Group

texts.es: El grupo Toxiflor está compuesto por cuatro personas dos mujeres y dos hombre ellos  tienen una bonita amistad desde hace varios años, se conocen muy bien entre a ellos los cuatro son personas muy trabajadoras, pero sobre todo muy responsables; llevan muchos ciclos trabajando con VisionFund. Ellos viven en la misma comunidad donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica al comercio. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente porque tres de los integrantes se dedican al cultivo de Flores para arreglos florales. Doña Domitila o Domi, como le dicen de cariño, platica que tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Juan desde hace ya varios años, ya no tienen ningún hijo que dependa de ellos todos han crecido y se mantienen económicamente. Ella solo estudio la secundaria pero es una mujer muy trabajadora su responsabilidad es lo que la distingue. Ella se dedica al cultivo de abono orgánico  para su venta hay dos tipos solido y liquido su abono es producido por el pie de cría de sus lombrices este proceso se llama Lumbricaria consiste en comprar el pie de cría(lombrices grandes), alimentarlas solo con desperdicios orgánicos de frutas, comida y verduras, es como las lombrices comienzan a hacer su trabajo de trasformar todo los residuos orgánicos en abono solido o en abono liquido. Estos tipos de abono se pueden aprovechar en cualquier tipo de cultivo, los beneficios es que son de buen calidad, es más saludable, está disponible a todo el público, pero sobretodo es orgánico a diferencia de los fertilizantes químicos los cuales son malos para la salud y también perjudican al medio ambiente. Doña Doño lleva 14 años con su actividad: “La inicié porque yo vendía solo el camote del alcatraz amarillo, la vendía en macetas en los mercados pero también inicie con mi negocio por necesidad porque todos mis hijos se encontraban estudiando nuestros gastos eran demasiado de alguna manera tenía la responsabilidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar” Ahora Doña Domitila se dedica a la producción de flores de varios tipos porque con estas elabora arreglos florales para cual fiesta o evento. Ha recibido  varios cursos de diseño floral para poder obtener clientes siempre es contratada para los mejores eventos de su comunidad o de otros lugares. Sin embargo no es la única actividad económica también se dedica al cultivo de haba, jitomate, nopales, duraznos. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar rollos de plástico para sus invernaderos de jitomate necesita cambiar algunos  plásticos en malas condiciones, todos sus cultivos son producidos con el mismo abono en algunos casos el liquido o en otros el sólido. Doña Domi comento “Para poder obtener tantos beneficios de la naturaleza debemos apreciarla  saber amarla”. Ella está muy contenta con todos sus logros, porque además de todas sus actividades también puede dar empleo a otras personas como Don Vicente y José Ramón quien también integran el grupo. En todas las actividades invierten los tres, las ganancias son repartidas entre ellos pero su sueldo es extra. El único obstáculo es la falta de dinero para comprar las cosas necesarias como herramienta, plásticos para invernaderos, máquinas etc. Ellos están muy agradecidos con KIVA y VisionFund porque de alguna manera han con tribuido para lograr el éxito obtenido en sus actividades económicas Doña Teresa quien también forma parte del grupo ella también tiene una pequeña lumbricaria sin embargo esta vez está solicitando el crédito para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: The Toxiflor group is made up of four people, two women and two men. They have a nice friendship and know each other very well. The four of them are very hardworking, but above all very responsible. They have been working with VisionFund for several cycles. They all live in the same community, where most residents work as merchants. They chose the name of the group because three of them work in flower cultivation for floral arrangements.  Domitila,  or Domi,as they affectionately call her, says that she is 48 years old. She has been married to Juan for several years. They don't have any dependent children any more because they have all grown and support themselves. She only went to secondary school but she is a hardworking woman. Her responsibility is what distinguishes her. She works making organic fertilizer. There are two types, solid and liquid. Her fertilizer is produced by raising worms. The process is called lumbricaria. It consists of buying broodstock (large worms), and feeding them  only organic waste from fruit, food and vegetables. That is how the worms start to do their work of transforming the organic residuals into liquid or solid fertilizer. These types of fertilizer can be used on any type of crop. The benefits are that they are good quality, is healthier, and it is available to everyone. Above all, it is organic, different from chemical fertilizers that are unhealthy and hurt the environment. Doño has been doing this activity for 14 years. "I started it because I used to sell yellow lilies. I sold them in flowerpots in the markets but I also started my business out of necessity because all of my children were in school and our expenses were too much. I had the responsibility somehow to help with the household expenses.” Now Domitila works growing flowers of all types because she makes floral arrangements with them for parties or events. She has taken several floral design courses in order to gain customers. She is always hired for the best events in her community or in other places. Nonetheless, this isn't her only economic activity. She also grows beans, tomatoes, nopal cactus and peaches. This time, she is asking for a loan to buy rolls of plastic for her tomato greenhouses. She needs to change some plastic that is in poor condition. All of her crops are grown with the same fertilizer, sometimes liquid and sometimes solid. Domi remarked “To be able to obtain so much benefit from nature, we have to appreciate it, and know how to love it.”. She is very happy with everything she has achieved, because in addition to all of her activities, she can also provide employment to others such as Vicente and José Ramón, who are also members of the group. All of them invest in all the activities. The profits are divided among the three of them, but her salary is extra. The only obstacle is a lack of money to buy necessary things such as tools, plastic for the greenhouses, machinery, etc. They are very grateful to Kiva and VisionFund because they have contributed to being able to achieve success in her economic activities. Teresa, who is also a part of the group, also has a small  lumbricaria, but she is asking for the loan to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rolls of plastic for her greenhouses.

loans.name: Barrio El Riito Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Barrio el Riito" esta integrado por 8 mujeres todas son muejres mazahuas que pertenecen a la misma comunidad la cual es muy bonita e interesante porque tiene varias fiestas en todo el año, sobretodo porque aun conservan sus culturas como su lengua materna y su vestimenta muy colorida. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas porque viven muy cerca de un río pequeño. Las personas de esa comunidad utilizan esta agua para usos multiples. Doña Antonia es un miembro del grupo ella tiene 37 años de edad esta casada desde hace ya 19 años con el señor Felipe quien trabaja como albañil juntos han formado una familia cuatro niños dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando Doña Antonia esta solicitando el credito para comprar más pollos ella los compra desde muy chicos para comprarlos a un precio mas barato los crece y engorda durante un tiempo para después venderlos a sus vecinas que normalmente es cuando hacen algún tipo de fiesta. Con sus ganancias, ella puede comprale zapatos, ropa y alimentos a sus niños. En caso de que no venda sus animalitos, ella los prepara como alimento para su familia asi tambien ahorran un poco de dinero. Doña Antonia comento sonriendo "Asi no gastamos y le damos algo nutritivo nada mejor que un buen gallo criado desde casa". El unico incoveniente para Doña Antonia es cuando sus pollos enferman y mueren en esta postura no hay ninguna ganancia sin embargo Doña Antonia es una mujer muy trabajadora y positiva no piensa dejar su negocio es una muy buena actividad porque asi puede estar al pendiente de sus hijos. La meta de Doña Antonia es llegar a tener un buen gallinero donde pueda tener muchos pollos para su venta. Los integrantes del grupo estan muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque podran invertir en sus negicios: 

Doña Teresa y Elodia podrán comprar mas pollos, mientras que Doña Luisa,Rosaura, Pilar, Tomasa y Antonia están solicitando el crédito para comprar mas borregos y finalmente Doña Herlinda podrá abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The group, "Barrio el Riito" is made up of eight women, all of whom are Mazahuas.  They belong to the same community, which is very beautiful and interesting because it has various festivals all year, and above all because they preserve their culture like their native language and very colorful dress.  They chose the name of the group themselves because they live very close to a small river.  The people in this community use water for multiple uses.  Doña Antonia is  member of the group who is thirty-seven  She has been married to Felipe for nineteen years.  He works as a construction worker.  Together, they have formed a family with four children, two of whom are still in school.  Antonia is requesting a loan to buy more chickens.  She buys them when they are very small so she can buy them at a cheaper price.  She grows them and fattens them for awhile and later sells them to her neighbors, usually around the time when a festival occurs.  With her profits, she can buy shoes, clothing, and food for her children.  If she doesn't sell her animals, she prepares them for her family, so they can also save a little money that way.  Antonia told us, while smiling, "This way we don't spend money and we have something nutritious.  There is nothing better than a good chicken raised at home."  The only inconvenience for her is when her chickens get sick and die because there aren't any profits this way.  Nevertheless, she is a very hard-working and positive woman.  She doesn't plan to stop her business because it is a very good activity since she can look after her children.  Her goal is to have a good henhouse where she can have many chickens to sell.  The members of her group are very happy and thankful for Vision Fund and Kiva because they are able to invest in their businesses.

Doña Teresa and Elodia will be able to buy more chickens, while Doña Luisa, Rosaura, Pilar, Tomasa, and Antonia are requesting a loan to buy more sheep.  Finally, Doña Herlinda will be able to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

location.town: San Antonio La Cienega, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is a 24-year-old lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colours, and packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch more dresses on time in order to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colours, and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Aasma

texts.en:
Aasma is a 32-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past three years. She is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in hotel marketing but he does not earn enough to support his family well on his own. Aasma’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is the mother of two children, both of whom are school-going. As she wants to grow her business she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities in order to meet with increasing demand. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Norma Evelin

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 43 años de edad, que se esfuerza cada día por un futuro mejor, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos. Se creció con sus abuelos, con ellos aprendió a trabajar la tierra, pero ella manifiesta que le gusta mas el trabajar con ganado.
Ya acompañada se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado, además tiene crianza de gallinas que las vende en épocas navideñas a mejor precio.
Compra sus insumos en una ciudad, donde tiene que trasladarlos en camión dos kilómetros de su casa, pagando este servicio a vecinos que tienen este medio. 
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar  3 terneros y aprovechar el zacate del cultivo de maíz que tiene ya cosechado. Necesita el dinero para aprovechar la época de abundancia de alimento para repastar el ganado y no tener que incurrir en altos costos de producción y obtener ingresos al vender sus animales que le permitirán hacerle frente a las necesidades del hogar.
Quiere tener varias cabezas de ganado y una maquina de ordeño y así poder hacer quesos y venderlos en el cantón.
texts.en:
Norma is a 43 year old woman. She strives day to day for a better future. She is married and has four children. She grew up with her grandparents and from them she learned to work the land, but she says that she likes working with cattle more. 

When she married she decided to work raising cattle. She also raises chickens that she sells at Christmastime at a better price. She buys her materials in town and has to transport them in a truck two kilometers to her house, paying her neighbors for the service because they have the truck. 

The loan will be used to buy 3 calves to take advantage of the corn hay that she has already harvested. She needs the money to take advantage of the abundance of feed to graze the cattle and not have to incur high expenses in production cost and to obtain income from selling her animals which will allow her to pay for her household expenses.  

She wants to have several heads of cattle and a milking machine so she can make cheese and sell in the canton.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves and to take advantage of the hay from the corn crop that she has already harvested.

loans.name: Adely

texts.es:
Adely tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas. Se dedicaba a la agricultura porque su padre le había enseñado esa actividad, ya casada decidió comprar unas vacas lecheras para elaborar queso; para el consumo de su familia, pero con el tiempo a podido observar que tiene mercado la venta de queso fresco, ya que las vecinas le encargaban y así esta obteniendo frutos de la inversión. 
Su esposo se dedica a cuidar sus 3 vaquitas y cultivar pipían. Compra sus insumos en dos ciudades, compra parte de la leche que utiliza para elaborar queso y la transporta en el bus.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera, porque las que tiene no le dan abasto para elaborar suficiente queso para la demanda que tiene, y ha estado comprando una parte de la leche que utiliza.
Con lo que espera, mejorar sus ingresos para su familia y ayudar a sus dos hijas que tiene estudiando en la universidad.
Su objetivo es, tener el negocio de queso fresco bien definido y abasteciendo las tiendas de la zona.
texts.en: Adely is fifty, is married, and has two daughters.  She used to make a living through agriculture since her father taught her this work.  When she got married, she decided to buy dairy cows to make cheese for her family to eat.  With time, she noticed that there was a market for fresh cheese since her neighbors would request it from her, and this is how she makes profits from her investment.  Her husband cares for their three cows and grows squash.  She buys her supplies in two cities.  She buys part of the milk that she uses to make cheese and transports it on the bus.  She will use this loan to buy another dairy cow because the ones she has don't supply enough milk to make enough cheese to meet her demand, and she has been buying part of the milk that she uses.  She hopes to improve her family's income and to help her two daughters, who are in college.  Her objective is to have a well-defined cheese business and to supply stores in the area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow because the ones she has don't produce enough milk to make enough cheese to meet her demand.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan es muy joven tiene 24 años de edad sin embargo sus ganas de poder superarse lo han motivado a emprender su negocio. Él es soltero, vive y trabaja con sus padres. Jonathan es muy trabajador siempre muy responsable con todas sus actividades vive en un municipio el cual es considerado como pueblo mágico. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito individual para comprar tela, hilos, resortes, agujas, aceites para las maquinas y botones para elaborar uniformes escolares en la actividad lleva ya 9 años trabajando.  La inició porque sus padres fueron quienes comenzaron con la costura hace 30 años. Jonathan aprendió muy rápido gracias a la enseñanza de su madre su papá también participa activamente en el negocio. El crédito le ayudara a para invertir más, las clases están por iniciar en el próximo mes y tiene ya varios encargos para varias escuelas. Jonathan comenta “Nuestra única dificultad en estos momentos es la falta de dinero para obtener todos los materiales, necesitamos fuertes cantidades de dinero para poder cumplir con todos nuestros encargos” Sus uniformes son distribuidos a otras municipios no solo donde ellos viven. El sueño de Jonathan es hacer crecer mas su negocio para poder llegar a dar sus servicios en otros lugares, quizás emprender otro taller de costura.
texts.en: Jonathan is very young. He is 24 years old, but his will to get ahead has motivated him to start his business. He is single and lives and works with his parents. Jonathan is very hardworking and always very responsible in all of his activities. He lives in a town that is considered magical. This time, he is asking for an individual loan to buy fabric, springs, needles, oil for the machines, and buttons  to make school uniforms. He has been working in this activity for 9 years. He started it because his parents started sewing 30 years ago. Jonathan learned very quickly thanks to his mother's teaching. His father also participates actively in the business. The loan will help him to invest more. Classes will start next month and he has several orders from several schools. says: “our only difficulty at this time is the lack of money to obtain materials. We need large quantities of money in order to fill all of our orders." The uniforms are distributed to other towns, not just where they live. Jonathan's dream is to make his business grow so he can service other places and perhaps open another sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Angela Johanna

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Empezó cuando el padre de sus hijos la dejó, entonces compró mercadería poco a poco hasta que pudo montar el bazar que tiene ahora.  Labora sola todos los días desde temprano en la mañana.  Está separada desde hace 4 años y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 y otro de 8 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Desea en el futuro llegar a tener un gran bazar con mucha mercadería.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en cuadernos, marcadores y relojes para su negocio.
texts.en:
The borrower is from the Guasmo area in Guayaquil. She started when the father of her children left her, then she bought merchandise little by little until she was able to set up the shop she has now. 

She works alone every day from early in the morning. She has been separated for four years and has two children. One is 10 and the other 8, and they go to public school. 

In the future she wishes to succeed in having a large store with a great deal of merchandise. For now she needs a loan to invest in notebooks, markers and watches.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, markers and watches.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel, es un señor que se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia, tiene a dos de sus hijos a su cargo, de las edades de 16 y 22 años, quienes estudian y también trabajan su esposa es ama de casa quien también depende de él, a los que mantiene de su labor como electro mecánico hospitalario. Manuel está solicitando el crédito para mejorar el baño y ampliar un cuarto de su vivienda, comprando arena, cemento, hierro, bloques, con esto empezara la obra que es tan importante para el bienestar de su familia y sobre todo mantener la higiene en el hogar.
texts.en: Manuel is a man who is concerned about the welfare of his family. He has two children he is responsible for, who are 16 and 22 years old. They  both study and his spouse is a housewife so they all depend on him. He works as an electrical mechanic at a hospital. Manuel is requesting this loan to fix the bathroom and make another room bigger. He will buy cement, re-bar, cinder blocks and with this, start this project that is so important to the well-being of his family. And above all help keep their house hygienic.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, re-bar and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Familia El Arca Group

texts.es: Familia El Arca es un grupo familiar lo integran  Don Candelario y  Doña Hermelinda quienes son padres de Carlos, ellos viven en una comunidad muy tranquila las personas acostumbran sembrar maíz como cultivo. Carlos comenta “Me gusta mucho el desfile que celebran en mi comunidad el día 16 de septiembre día de la independencia de México, en muchos otros lugares ya no se celebran con esa emoción; aquí, si” El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque lo relacionan con su actividad económica que es la carpintería y un pasaje de la biblia donde nos relata como Noé salvo a los animales del gran diluvio gracias a un arca de madera. Carlos quien es el representante del grupo tiene 36 años de edad está casado con Guadalupe desde hace ya 13 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños dos de ellos asisten a la escuela. Carlos desde hace 8 años tiene su propia carpintería él aprendió el oficio de carpintero gracias a su papá. Don Candelario fue quien inició la actividad, Carlos aprendió hacer hacer puertas, mesas, cocinas integrales, sillas, muebles para oficina, etc. Para hacer acabados y barnizados tuvo que tomar algunos cursos, esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar un rauter y un taladro, ya tiene estas herramientas, pero ya tiene mucho tiempo con ellas y necesita cambiarlas. En el negocio de Carlos su única dificultad es la falta de espacio, tiene un local en su misma casa y es muy pequeño para poder trabajar adecuadamente, está obligado a utilizar otros espacios de su casa. Carlos argumenta: “Mi meta es llegar a tener una carpintería más amplia para poder tener mas clientes y así aumentar mis ganancias, lo más importante para mí, son mis hijos, me gustaría verlos realizados profesionalmente si yo pude terminar la preparatoria ellos deberán estudiar una carrera profesional”. Don Candelario y Doña Hermelinda invertirán también en su carpintería. Doña Hermelinda se encarga de elaborar los cojines para las sillas de madera.
texts.en:
The Ark Family is made up of Candelario and Hermelinda, who are Carlos's parents. They live in a very peaceful community where people usually grow corn as their main crop. Carlos says “I really like the parade my community puts on to celebrate the 16th September, Mexico’s Independence Day.  In other places they don’t celebrate it with so much excitement anymore, but here we do”.  The family chose the name of their group because it relates to their area of work, which is carpentry. If we take a look at the bible, it tells us how Noah saved the animals from a great flood thanks to a wooden ark.

Carlos, the representative of the group, is 36 years old and has been married to Guadalupe for 13 years. They have three children, two of whom go to school. Carlos has had his own carpentry business for the last eight years, which he was able to open thanks to his dad, Candelario, who was the one who began the business. Carlos learnt how to make doors, tables, open-plan kitchens, chairs, office furniture, etc. To learn how to finish and varnish furniture he had to take some courses. 

This time he is applying for a loan to purchase a drill and a router. He already has these tools, but he has had them for a long time and they need changing. The only difficulty in Carlos’s business is the lack of space. He runs a store from his own house and as it is very small, he has had to take over other areas of his house in order to work properly. Carlos explains “my goal is to have a larger carpentry store so I can receive more customers and increase my income. The most important thing for me is my children. I would like to see them become successful professionals. If I could finish my foundation studies, they should be able to study a professional degree”. 

Candelario and Hermelinda are also involved in his carpentry business. Hermelinda is in charge of making cushions for the wooden chairs.

loans.use: to buy a drill and a router

location.town: Purisima Concepcion Mayorazgo, San Felipe del Prog

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre de 44 años de edad, está casado con Victoria de 42 años con quien vive en su casa de madera. Marcelino se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy joven aprendió las distintas técnicas que se debe emplear para obtener una buena producción de cacao. Generalmente para culminar las tareas rutinarias de sus terrenos de cultivo convoca a trabajadores del lugar quienes al ser ex compañeros suyos se sienten a gusto con el trabajo que desempeñan logrando posteriormente obtener muy buenas ganancias. No obstante comenta que sus productos sufrieron una disminución en el pago del precio final perjudicándolo notablemente.
Desea contar con capital suficiente que le permita iniciar la campaña productiva con todas las de ganar, para ello debe contar con mano de obra firme de los trabajadores del lugar para el deshierbo y adquirir sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 44 and married to Victoria, 42, with whom he lives in a wooden house. Marcelino works in agriculture. From a young age he learnt the different necessary techniques to get a good harvest of cocoa beans. Generally, to finish off the routine tasks in his fields, he summons workers in the region to help. Being ex workmates of his, they feel at ease with the work they do, having been able to make a good living out of it previously. Nevertheless he tells us that the final price he was paid for the harvest was lower than usual, which was significantly detrimental to him.  

Marcelino would like to have enough capital to begin the harvest season with everyone who stands to gain from it. For that to happen he has to have a strong team of workers from the region on hand to weed and get sacks of organic fertiliser for sowing.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful to receive the financial support which allows him to continue with his business. He also promises to make his repayments punctually. On this occasion he would like to have 1000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertiliser.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 30-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two and is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Five years ago, she started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list.

In order to cope with the orders of her customers on time, she needs to buy thread along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons in different colors. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy thread along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons in different colors.

loans.name: Lovender

texts.en:
Lovender is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Her husband has a part time job driving a motorcycle offering transportation services to the community. To help her husband, she operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting coconuts to sell. She has been with her business for four years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

Lovender requested a new loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure because the department of agriculture suggested using an organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en: Saleema is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough to meet the needs of her three children. For the improvement of her business she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en:
Grecilda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Grecilda is a married woman and has been in the business for more than eight years now. This is the source of her income.

Grecilda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Grecilda hopes to expand her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house for many years. She offers various types of grocery items for daily use. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salt, flour, rice, biscuits and beverages to cater to more customers. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, flour, rice, biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda is a 42-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to purchase two more baby cows. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby cows.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a clothing sales business for five years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her area. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy more stock of clothes in different colors and designs for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. It's her third year with Kashf Foundation and she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy a clothes in different colors and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda earns a living through her food vending business. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Imelda sells home cooked snack foods to the people in her area. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena, age 30, is a married woman and a mother of three. She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to meet the growing needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Rubab's Group

texts.en:
Rubab is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of the business. 

For that Rubab is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the amount of profit he will put aside some savings amount to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Rubab hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than three years now. He is a married man and the father of two young children.

Jenie is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Jenie hopes to expand his business so that it will generate more revenue which will be used for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been stitching sacks and bags for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Nasreen stitches sacks in different sizes and then her husband sells them in the market at reasonable prices. They are happily doing it for the sake of their family and earn enough to lead a decent life. Nasreen is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy bundles of cloth with more spools of thread to inflate her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth with more spools of thread.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 35-year-old married woman; she has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Hasena

texts.en: Hasena is a 33-year-old married lady; she has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Hasena makes enough to provide for her family. To fully-stock her store, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000, which she will use to buy packs of biscuits, snacks, and sweets from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize a part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, snacks, and sweets for her general store business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in the air-conditioning business since 2006. He is a talented person who is dedicated to his business. He is well known in his region due to his special customer service and neat work. He is recommended by almost all of his customers. Mohamad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase and renew his business required tools. This loan will help him a lot in his business development. This is Mohamad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan enabled him to do maintenance work on his car which was necessary for the development and expansion of his business. He hopes that in the future he can open a shop which he can use as his base for his business instead of using his car as his mobile shop.

loans.use: to increase and renew his business required tools

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, age 46, lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district and has four children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava to make a living. They complement the income by working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for twenty-six years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
This is the first micro loan for Sokhom’s Group with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava in a timely way so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material for making utensils.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman and the mother of two children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. Josephine, together with her husband, has been engaged in fishing for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income. Josephine is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Josephine hopes to make their business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen, aged 35, is a hardworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that their family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a spare parts shop which is the only source of income for the family. Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase products for his shop. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Sangke district. Three of her children are still in school in the area. Rice farming is the only, and main, source of her family’s income and she has been farming rice for about eight years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 26,000 KHR but she is able to save 6,000 KHR every day. This is the fifth loan for Vanna with VisionFund. She has completely paid back her past loans with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Vanna is going to use her portion to  buy fertiliser and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy so as to make a living.

loans.use: to use her portion to buy fertiliser and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en: Zaib, aged 54, is a married woman. She has a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing which is a thread-like material used in making bedsteads from wooden frames on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and has become famous by providing good quality material in her community. She operates the machine at home which she is contently doing for the sake of her family. It’s her 2nd year with Kashf Foundation, currently she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with good quality thread to increase her sales. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move towards a positive direction as a result of the investment from the loan.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with good quality thread.

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en: Shahzia is a 26-year-old married woman, providing services for recycling for the past two years. She buys PET bottles like Pepsi, Coke and Mirinda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) or other similar bottles. After properly cleaning and recycling these bottles, she sells them in the local market. Through her business she makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has four children and is liable to provide them with good food, health and education so she needs to earn more income to support her family. In order to expand her business she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000/- to buy bottles of different sizes in larger quantity to inflate her sales. She expects to boost her earning and wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy bottles of different sizes in larger quantities to inflate sales in her recycling business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol and has been in the business for more than eight years now. He is married. This is the source of his income. Joel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm productivity. In the future, Joel hopes of expanding his business as well as his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the province of Kampong Cham's Ponhea Krek district, Sokheng, age 39, has three children, two of whom are still in school. Sokheng and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for 19 years to make a living. She earns about 17,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sokheng’s group consists of three members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sokheng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice and cassava healthily and also hopes to make more rice to better her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin, age 43, lives with her husband and seven children in a village in the province of Kampong Cham’s Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava and rubber on three hectares of farmland. Together, they earn about 36,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Phin is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rubber field. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rubber and cassava on time to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rubber field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is working as tailor. This is the only source of income for his family.

Shazia, as a member of a two-person lending group, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a sewing machine to stitch dresses. This will help him to respond quickly to customer needs. Shazia will start a savings for her children's future with the profit amount. Shazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 41, is widowed with three children. She and her family reside in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district of the Kandal province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 18 years. She earns about KHR 35,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs. 

Phalla is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of the loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes to make more rice so as to increase her family’s income, enabling them to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Lizelda

texts.en:
Lizelda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Lizelda has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm thus augmenting their yield and income. Lizelda hopes to expand her business and make it a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. She has been doing a business of milk sales to contribute to the family income for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with yogurt and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. She earns enough to afford a decent life through her business. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to cater to more people in her locality. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to use the earned profit for the betterment of her family members' lives.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for her milk sales business.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years and knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers, buttons and laces for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Marcela has been engaged in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 24-year-old single man, living at his parents' house with six family members to take care of. He is the owner of a carpentry workshop in his area, and he has been working in this domain for two and a half years now. He is the major financial source of the family and the sole breadwinner of the entire family. This means that they all rely heavily on him to provide food, shelter and other needs.

He contacted Al Majmoua hoping to apply for a YOUTH loan that would alleviate his burdens. He needs to purchase necessary requested wood to develop his business. He is the only member of the family who is able to pay off the loan. As for his future career plans, Hussein hopes to expand the business he is doing.

loans.use: To buy necessary requested wood to develop his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, beads, thread for embriodery business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery and general household items for her general store business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Gifty is an entrepreneur. She works as a hairdresser in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Gifty is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. 

Gifty wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of hair products, hence allowing her to generate more business. In the long term, Gifty plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of hair products

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma, aged 28, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She is a dedicated mother of two children. She needs to improve her business to meet their needs. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs.15,000 to purchase one more goat. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 58-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She makes enough through her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains for her general store business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a food vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 15 years now. She sells home cooked foods and sells it to the people in her hometown. This is the source of her income. 

Marciana is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook more foods thus allowing her to sell more and augment her income. Marciana hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Marecho

texts.en:
Marecho sells home cooked foods to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Marecho has been vending food for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Marecho is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business, like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook more foods and sell it to her customers. She dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina runs a sari-sari, or variety, store business selling goods and items to the people near her place in Trinidad, Bohol. Josefina is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks thus attract more customers. In the future, Josefina hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Mary Jean has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 12 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. Mary Jean hopes to expand their farming venture so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. Milagros is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this,she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. Milagros dreams of expanding their business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a hairdresser for nine years. She is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation in her domain. Unfortunately, at this time she can't move her business to a separate place outside her house because of her family's weak financial situation.

Sawsan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to update her business with newly released beauty items. She will also invest part of this loan to support her husband's business through buying special car spare parts that will increase his business income.

This is Sawsan's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that future loans might help her in establishing her own separate beauty salon to expand her working zone and attract more customers.

loans.use: To update her business with newly released beauty items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a small scale food vendor in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Alice has been working as a food vendor for close to two years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Alice plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of cooking ingredients for her tasty dishes, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cooking ingredients for her tasty dishes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells local dishes in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have four children. Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cooking ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cooking ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Even though Cecilia grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She sells accessories in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Cecilia has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more accessories to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories to sell

loans.name: Belekisu

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Belekisu is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling belts in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Belekisu is married and has three children. Her husband works as an herbalist. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Belekisu will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of belts, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Belekisu plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of belts

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells children's clothing in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of children's clothing, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of children's clothing

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en: Ishrat is a 48-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns blanket shop; it is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that reason, Ishrat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of blankets to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.
