With the help of profit amount, he will put a side some savings to pay the electricity and gas bill. Ishrat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of blankets to sell

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.en:
Sinforosa is engaged in the hog raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in this business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Sinforosa is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Yeri

texts.en: Yeri is a 35-year-old single woman. Prior to engaging in her sewing business, she used to work as a weaver. In 2008, Yeri was involved in training for sewing for two years. She also received grants by a local agency for initial capital and a sewing machine. From the skill, she is able to commence a home-based sewing business. She runs the business by producing woman’s clothes i.e. skirts, blouses, etc. She also would love to create some handicrafts such as tissue boxes and key chains in her spare time and sell them. Recently, Yeri sees that her businesses has good prospects in the future; that is why she plans to increase the number of clothes she sews by getting a new hemming machine. Therefore, she asks for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She hopes that her business will get better and that she is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new hemming machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Prima has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm as well as the yield and their income. Prima is optimistic that they will be able to improve their livelihood through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow and has been in the farming business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Susana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these supplies, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida operates a business selling beans and groundnuts in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Vida is a widow with five children. As the sole breadwinner of the family, Vida uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Vida will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of beans and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. As a middle school graduate, Vida understands the importance of education in improving social conditions; thus, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married with 6 children. She received some schooling till the end of primary school. Currently, Aba sells fish in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 15 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Aba’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Aba will use the loan to increase her existing fish capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Aba plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing fish capacity.

loans.name: Norley's Group

texts.en:
This group has three members and is led by Norley. The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including fish, plantain and maize. The group members live in the same neighborhood. This group is part of a larger group called Universal.

This loan will bring benefits to these small business owners, including Norley. She says that she joined this group three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Norley now has a business selling smoked fish which she has run for six years. She says that she learned this business a number of years ago on her own initiative by observing how this market works.

Norley (standing in the middle of the photograph) is taking this loan to increase her capital for buying and selling fish. She will make her purchases of fish from the fishing shore in the city of Accra. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, she answered that she likes having quick access to loans and being able to save.
She and her colleagues need a total amount of GHS 1,900 to be able to serve customers better.

loans.use: To purchase fish from the fishing shore in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 46 years old. He is married, has a 20-year-old son, and lives with his family in the Yeghegnut village. Andranik became the only breadwinner of the family when his father died. He has been providing electrician services for 5 years already. Due to his hard work Andranik has gained many customers who are using his service and are very satisfied. 

Currently Andranik needs some financial support for purchasing supplies for his business. He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Andranik to be able to continue his business and sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for his business.

loans.name: Smile Group

texts.en:
Saida is the featured borrower of Smile group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, when they came to Lebanon to work as housekeepers to make their living.

Saida is a 46-year-old divorced mother of one child, and she works as a housekeeper for her own and her family's living. With her loan, Saida will pay for her child's living expenses. She is working hard that one day she can save a good amount of money to move back home and start her own business next to her beloved child.

Saida is the one sitting at the right. As for the other group members, Mainnculada is the one in the middle, and Viveliza is the one standing at the left.

loans.use: to pay for her child's living expenses.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Florence decided to set up her own fish business in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). With over eight years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

For this reason, Florence has requested this loan, which will be used to help her to purchase more fish for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which claims beautiful countryside "very smart". He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming!' His biggest challenge is: 'Lack of capital.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chemingin'.

Charles was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because they improve the living standard of farmers.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It has a flexible repayment period.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Charles replied, 'Increased income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Charles owns the following: 'cow, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these supplies, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm as well as the yield and profit. Victoria hopes to make her farming venture a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a rice and beans selling business in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Grace is a single mother with 1 child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Grace uses her income to provide for the entire family. Grace will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and beans, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Grace understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice and beans.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y ha procreado ocho hijos. Aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura desde la edad de 10 años con su papá, eran cinco hermanos, él era el único hombre y tuvo que ayudarle arduamente a su papá para sobrellevar los compromisos de la familia.
Ya casado sigue cultivando la tierra, tiene 8 hijos, 2 ya se le acompañaron, y actualmente tiene 6 en la casa que le ayudan a trabajar la tierra.
Compra sus insumos y materiales en la ciudad, donde tiene que trasladarlos en carreta hasta su cantón. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas; para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en el terreno que esta alquilando para potrero, pero quiere aprovecharlo también para cultivar y obtener un poco mas de ingresos para su familia.
Tendrá acceso a otros ingresos para hacerle frente a las necesidades básicas 
Quiere adquirir  su terrenito para cultivar, sin tener que pagar alquiler año con año. Y dejarle la posible ganancia que puede quedarle a él al cultivar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 64 years old. He is married with eight children. He started to learn about working in agriculture when he was 10 years old, from his dad. Growing up Manuel had four sisters and so he had to help his father with the arduous work needed to meet the family’s needs.

He continued to work the land after he got married. He has 8 children, 2 of whom are in long-term relationships. At present 6 children still live in the family home. They help him work the land. He buys supplies and materials in the city, and transports them to his locality by wagon. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilisers, pesticides and herbicides. He will use these to farm the 7,000 square metres of corn he is growing in paddocks that he is renting. He is wants to use this land to grow different crops and earn a little more income for his family.
In this way he will have access to other income to meet his family’s basic needs. He would like to buy the plot of land he cultivates, so that he doesn’t have to pay rent year after year. This would give him the possibility of investing some of his earnings back into the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, pesticide and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square metres of corn he is growing in land he is renting.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: At the age of 51, Mumtaz is an energetic married woman. She has been in the business of making flowers for many years; it has been her passion. She knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric, paper and other materials which are used for decorating homes and for events. She also arranges handmade wedding garlands for brides and grooms and flowers out of every material she finds suitable. Her experience in the art of flower-making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation and for the improvement of her business she requires a loan of Rs. 30,000/- to buy raw materials such as fabrics, shiny papers or tissue papers along with the packs of wires and floral tapes. In this way, she will increase her sales which ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, shiny paper or tissue paper along with the packs of wires and floral tapes.

loans.name: Maame Adjoa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Maame Adjoa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells sugar and bread in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 1 year. As a divorcee with 6 children, Maame Adjoa uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of sugar and bread, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Maame Adjoa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of sugar and bread, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is involved in selling rice, sugar and bread in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a farmer) support their 5 children. She has been involved in selling rice, sugar and bread for 8 years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of rice, sugar and bread, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory. She aspires to use her profits both to better market her rice, sugar and bread enterprise and also to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of rice, sugar and bread, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en: Wenifreda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Wenifreda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Georgina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice in Assorkor (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Georgina is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Georgina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Georgina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: After graduating Junior High School, Charlotte decided to set up her own fish business in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). With over 2 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more fish for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngulu est trésorière du collectif  d’affaire  « Tupatane», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 ballons de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Ngulu is the treasurer of the Tupatane business group. A young experienced entrepreneur, Ngulu is 30 years old, married, and a mother of two children, who both go to school. Her husband is a teacher in a public school. 

Ngulu sells second-hand clothing. She displays her goods in a market, and sometimes at home. She started her business with a loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima about two years ago. This new loan will serve to buy two bales of second-hand clothing. 

Ngulu wishes to increase her business, educate and feed her children, and build a house. 

To finish up, Ngulu strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy two bales of second hand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 49, is married with a son, who is a student. The family lives in the town of Kobuleti. 

Nina has a vocational education. She graduated from the department of trading but does not work in that profession. She works as a nurse at the local kindergarten, and her husband is a mini-bus dispatcher. Both of them earn small salaries. Their total monthly income is approximately $200 (US), which is not enough for a family of three.

Nino used to trade in clothing among people in her neighborhood but her activity stopped due to financial difficulties. She had decided to restart the trading business but found that the family didn’t have enough savings to do so. She requested a loan from Credo. The application was approved under the framework of Credo’s startup program, which enables vulnerable poor people in rural areas to start or restart businesses. 

Once she has obtained her loan, Nino will purchase clothing from wholesalers and sell them in her community at a price mark-up. Her regular clients will be her co-workers and neighbors. She will work on special orders as well.

Nino hopes that she will generate revenue to help her family and give them what they need.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a small-scale watermelon seller in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education, as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has three children.

Elizabeth has been working as a watermelon seller for close to 12 years. Her husband is a driver. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using this loan to purchase an increased quantity of watermelon, thus enabling her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a watermelon stand and selling from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of watermelon

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a small-scale fish seller in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. 

Lydia has been working as a fish seller for close to eight years. Her husband is a driver. Her income is used to help her husband pay utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans to use this loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is single and has three children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Alice is now an established businesswoman. 

She sells fish in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast) and has been actively involved in this business for about 20 years. As the sole breadwinner, Alice uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Alice will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of fish to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish  to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Jerome

texts.fr: jerome est un homme de 61 ans, marié et père de 02 enfants. il possède et gère une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques dans un quartier de la ville  depuis 3 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits cosmétiques, tels que le crème de corps, shampoing, parfum etc.afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés seront injectés dans l'activité (capital) d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Jerome is a 61-year-old man, married, and a father of two children. He owns and has been running a cosmetics shop in his neighborhood for three years.

He is asking for a loan to increase his stock by buying cosmetics, especially body cream, shampoo, perfume, etc., in order to increase his revenue. 

Part of his earnings will be reinvested in his business, and the other part will support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Even though Regina grew up in poverty without an education, this did not stop her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Regina is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began it 10 years ago. 

Regina uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. She has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. 

She aims to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabatsi est membre du collectif  d’affaire  « Sheria», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont 1 etudie et les autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de sacs à mains. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son enfant, il y a environ 10 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 sacs à mains. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir son enfant qui est encore sous sa tutelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Kabatsi is the oldest member of the Sheria business group. She is an experienced entrepreneur, 60 years old, a widow, and a mother of seven children, of whom one goes to school. The other children already have their own households.

Kabatsi sells handbags. She displays her goods in a market, and sometimes in her home. She started this business about ten years ago with funds from one of her children.

This new loan will serve to buy 20 handbags. 

Kabatsi wishes to increase her business and to educate and feed her child that is still under her care.

Finally, Kabatsi strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 20 handbags

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Deepanjali

texts.en:
Deepanjali is a 26-year-old differently-able lady living with her parents and her younger brothers in a village of Ganjam District in Odisha, India. She is engaged in the activity of selling milk in her village and the market near her village. She has two cows in her dairy farm. She has two years of experience in this business.

Deepanjali  has a plan to purchase a few more cows and renovate the shed for her cattle. This would help her in generating more income and make her family financially strong.

Deepanjali has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing two new jersey cows. She has a dream to save some money for their future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two new jersey cows and renovating her cattle shed.

loans.name: Sishir Kumar

texts.en:
Sishir Kumar is a 44-year-old differently-able person living with his father, wife and two children. He owns and manages a variety store where he sells  detergents, betel, toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, biscuits, wafers, hair oil, etc. and earns 8,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for a family of five persons. 

He has a plan of expanding his business by adding a new product line of different kinds of sweets in his shop and adding more stock of the items he sells. He also wants to renovate his shop so that his client base increases.

Sishir Kumar has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for renovating his shop and purchasing the above-mentioned items. He has a dream to make his children well educated and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sweets and other household consumables for his variety shop.

loans.name: Achyutanand

texts.en:
Achyutanand is a 34-year-old differently-able person living with his parents in a small village of Ganjam District in Odisha, India. He is involved in the activity of making stone chips; he has some labourers working under him who help him in breaking the big rocks into small and medium-sized stone chips, which are used as a major component in construction. He supplies these stone chips to the dealers of construction supplies. He earns 8,000 INR from this business per month.

He wants to expand his business by purchasing more rocks and supplying in larger quantity. He also wants to establish his own shop in the market, so that he can directly supply the stones to the customers and earn more income.

Achyutanand has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing more rocks, establishing a shop in the market, and for hiring more work force. He has a dream to give a good living to his parents and save some money for his future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rocks, to establish a shop in the market, and for hiring more work force.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells groceries in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She has been educated till the end of junior high school.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a mason. 

Mary has been working in this business for 10 years now. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her grocery enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married to a driver. She has five children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. A junior high school graduate, Sarah currently sells food ingredients Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). With over 3 years of experience in this trade, Sarah sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock.

 Thus her loan will be used to buy more food ingredients, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Sarah wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy paper and gum for a paper envelope-making business.

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo. El posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, Don Jose esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 53 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and son.  Jose has a tailoring workshop in his home where he produces different clothing items.  He has recently gained many customers because he does excellent work and sells his products at affordable prices.  Jose is very dedicated to his work, and is responsible and honest.  Jose is applying for this loan as it will allow him to buy material, threads, needless and other items for tailoring, so that he can continue to satisfy his customers needs.  He will then have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy material, threads, needles and more.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad  vive en casa  propia  con su esposo  y sus tres  hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia,  es una persona muy  trabajadora  y responsable  por su esfuerzo en sus labores ella ha logrado tener muchos clientes, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para poder  invertir en su negocio y poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como: salsas de tomates, mayonesa, panes, jamón, pollos, mortadelas, repollos, etc. y poder mejorar el carretón donde los vende que es el muestra la fotografía y poder realizar más ventas  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia .
texts.en: Thirty-one-year-old Ana lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She makes a living selling food as a street vendor in the different areas near her home.  She is very hard-working and responsible.  As a result of her efforts at work, Ana has gained many customers.  She is applying for a loan in order to be able to invest in her business and to buy necessary ingredients such as tomato sauce, mayonnaise, bread, ham, chicken, Mortadella, cabbage and other ingredients.  She will also improve her cart (shown in the photograph) which she uses to sell her products.  With this she will be able to make more sales and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomato sauce, mayonnaise, bread, ham, chicken, Mortadella, cabbage and other ingredients, and to improve her cart.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en: Hanady is a 38-year-old married mother of four. She has been working at selling home products for a year, to help her husband increase their income and cover their family's expenses. Hanady is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a newly released collection, which will surely attract customers’ attention and create a need for the items displayed. Hanady wants to keep on developing her business in the future, either by opening a larger shop or another branch.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a newly released collection.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is involved in selling groceries in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is an auto electrician) support their two children. She has been engaged in selling groceries for eight years. She plans on using her loan to buy more groceries, thus helping her sell more due to her increased inventory. She aspires to use her profits both to improve the marketing of her grocery enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María  de 31 años de edad vive  en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos  es unas persona  responsable,  trabajadora y eficaz en sus labores,  por su experiencia  en cómo tratar a las personas  ella ha logrado ganarse aceptación de  sus clientes, ella se dedica a la ventas de perfume, cremas, desodorantes, ropa,  maquillaje entre etc. Es así como ella ha salido adelante con su familia, María esta  solicitando un crédito  para poder comprar más mercadería  por mayor para su negocio  y poder incrementar sus ventas así también sus ganancias y darle a su  hogar una mejor  calidad de vida .
texts.en: María is 31 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and two children.  She is responsible, hard-working and efficient in her work.  Given her experience and knowing how to treat people well, María has become accepted by her customers.  María makes a living selling perfumes, creams, deodorants, clothes, make-up and more.  With this work, María has managed to progress with her family.  María is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy more merchandise in bulk for her business.  She can then increase her sales, as well as her profits, and provide a better quality of living to her household.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, lotions and more in bulk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operates a salt-selling business in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). She is a divorcée with five children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esi will use the loan to buy more salt, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a middle school graduate, Esi understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to buy more salt to sell.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: El Sr. Teofilo tiene 58 años,  casado con dos hijos,  el es pescador el vive en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Teofilo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una bote pesquero de mayor capacidad su mercadería producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, el Sr. Teofilo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el viento que no le permite pescar por el olaje que levanta, El Sr. Teofilo es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse.
texts.en: Teofilo is 58 years old, married and has two children.  He is a fisherman and lives on an island in Lake Titicaca, a tourist area in the La Paz department.  In this area, tourists can buy woolen and reed artisan products.  The majority of the island's inhabitants make a living in the fishing and tourism industries.  This is Teofilo's first cycle with the communal bank and he will use this loan to buy a fishing boat with a larger capacity.  Teofilo sells his fish in the city of La Paz and, with this new boat, he wants to increase production and satisfy his customers demands.  Teofilo is facing challenges in his business, such as the wind, causing high waves, which means that he cannot fish.  Teofilo has a desire to get ahead and is happy and grateful to the institution for the support being provided.  This work is Teofilo's only source of income for supporting himself.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Beatrice decided to set up her own hairdressing business in Assorkor-Asaman (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funds. This loan will be used to help her by buy more hair products to sell. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who works binding steel) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their only child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her buy more hair products to sell.

loans.name: Mwangaluka Group

texts.en: Mwanaisha, who is born in the early 1970s, is married and lives with her husband. They are blessed with three children--two sons and one daughter. She managed to enroll one child in school, and the others are still young. Mwanaisha has been managing a business selling clothes door to door for a year. She sells her stock mostly on credit rather than for cash, due to the nature of her clients’ income flows and competition. She works from 9 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy clothes to sell. She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business by having business premises and selling more clothes. Mwanaisha will share this loan with the Mwangaluka loan group, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, canchos para el cabello, lápiz de labios entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The borrower earns a living selling all kinds of personal products such as lotions, deodorants, hair grips, lipstick and others. She runs her business from her home and with the profits she makes she is able to cover the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and her 2 children. 

She wants to increase her business and so she is asking for a loan to buy everything she needs such as perfumes, nail varnish and deodorants. She also wants to buy clothing since she has has a lot of customers thanks to her affordable prices. With the help of the loan she is asking for, she will be able to make better profits and so be able to continue providing everything her family needs.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, perfumes, nail varnish, deodorants and clothing.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has four children and has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Growing crops and rearing livestock.” His biggest challenge is “Lack of capital. “Animals on the farm have been given the name of “Boito.” Julius was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Equal installments.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “It increases income.” His highest monthly expense is for farming costs. When asked “How will this loan benefit his family”, Julius replied “Increased income.” As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Julius owns the following: “cow, pig” but does not own “poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile”. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, solar power, TV” but does not have “electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD”. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize, which will help her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. He has one child and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and transportation services. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Dairy farming.” His biggest challenge is “Lack of capital.” Animals on the farm have been given the name of “Chetuy.” Erick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Because they have suitable products for him.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “It has flexible loan terms.” His highest monthly expense is for farming costs. When asked “How will this loan benefit his family.”, Erick replied “It will lead to an increased source of income.” As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Erick owns the following: “cow, poultry, motorcycle” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, automobile”. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, TV” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD”. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing pen.

loans.name: Tuombe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kasoki est membre du collectif  d’affaire  « Tuombe», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 31 ans, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un Maître Macon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse de Farine de Maïs. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son familier (alors son grand frère), il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de farine de Maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Kasoki is a member of the Tuombe business group. A young experienced entrepreneur, Kasoki is 31 years old and a mother of six children, who all go to school. Her husband is a Master stonemason.

Kasoki sells corn flour. She displays her products at home. She started her business about six years ago with funds from a friend (and then her older brother).

This new loan will serve to buy four sacs of corn flour.

Kasoki wishes to increase her business, educate and feed her children, and build a house.

Finally, Kasoki strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs. 

It should be noted that some group members are holding their children.

loans.use: to buy four bags of corn flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, which will help her improve her sales of "Wakye’" (a traditional Ghanaian dish).

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: La Sra. Natividad  tiene 24 años y es casada, ella se dedica al tejido de mantas de manera artesanal desde hace ya cuatro años, su domicilio se encuentra  en el Zona de Achumani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Natividad va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un terreno, para el adelanto, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero para esta adquisición,  la señora  Natividad desea con el tiempo abrir una tienda propia para exponer sus tejidos ya que ahora entrega en los distintos mercados de la Ciudad y de la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que su sueño también es el poder construir su casita en el terreno que desea comprar.
texts.en:
Natividad, 24, is married and has made a living for the past four years knitting blankets in a traditional way. Her home is located in the Achumani area. This is her first loan cycle within this institution. Natividad is going to use this loan to make a deposit on the land she will buy. She is requesting this loan because she does not have enough money to make this purchase. 

Eventually, Natividad wishes to open up her own store so that she can exhibit her knitting, since now she delivers it to different markets in the city and the area. She is going to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life since her dream is also to be able to build her little home on the land that she wishes to buy.

loans.use: to acquire land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, de 33 años de está casada y vive en compañia de su esposo y sus tres hijos en la casa que compro hace algunos años. Desde niña se dedicó a la agricultura, comenzó a sembrar plátano, yuca y demás frutos. Comenta que a principios de año pensaba cultivar café pero una plaga afecto sus localidad y esto no le permitió seguir con sus sembríos. Ahora se concentra en los extensos cultivos de plátano que posee, pues este año el precio es bueno y desea aprovechar al máximo, así que todos los días cuida de sus plantaciones pues considera, que si no los cuida no tendrá la misma producción y necesita mayor cantidad frutos pata obtener las ganancias que desea, por esa razón empezará la fertilización para esta cosecha, que se desarrolla cada 15 días. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Ruth, invertirá los S/.1000 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old, is married and lives with her husband and her three children in the house which she bought a few years ago. She has worked in agriculture from a young age, beginning with bananas, yucca and other fruits. She says that at the start of the year she planned to grow coffee but her area was affected by disease and she was unable to continue with the crop. 

Now she is concentrating on her extensive banana crop, since this year the price is good and she wants to get the maximum benefit. She tends to the crops every day since she thinks that if she does not do this she will not get as good a yield and she needs more fruit to get the profits she hopes for. For this reason she will start using fertilizer for this harvest, which takes place every 15 days. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is being given to be able to make progress. Ruth will use the 1000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 50 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Lenin y sus 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la agricultura con los sembríos de café y plátano, comenta que posee pocos terrenos agrícolas y que gracias a Dios sembró para este año el tipo de café inmune a la plaga, por lo que no tuvo pérdidas y se encuentra cosechando. Su tiempo lo distribuye en las mañanas con el cuidado de sus sembríos de plátano y café, ya en la tarde se dedica al cuidado de su tienda, donde vende productos comestibles. Ahora desea abonar sus sembríos de plátano pues subió el precio en el mercado y dentro de 15 días desea obtener una buena producción gracias al abono orgánico. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Sonia, invertirá los S/.700 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50, is a responsible woman. She lives with her husband, Lenin, and their four children who she takes care of in the house she inherited from her parents. Her principal income comes from farming coffee and banana crops. She states that she has a bit of farm land and, thank God, this year she was able to sow the type of coffee that was immune to the blight, because of which she did not have losses and she is harvesting now. 

She distributes her time in the mornings between caring for her banana and coffee crops, since in the afternoon she takes care of her store, from which she sells edible products. Now she wishes to add compost to her banana crops since the market price went up, and within 15 days she hopes to obtain good production thanks to the organic compost. 

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support that she will receive to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments punctually. Sonia will invest 700 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic compost for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and oil to make more doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets and a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife. Seyran has three daughters who are married and live with their own families. Seyran has been involved in the repair of electronics for already 30 years. Over these years of hard work, Seyran has been known among his customers as a qualified service provider who loves the job he is doing. Seyran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for improving his business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Seyran's loan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to non-formal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Seyran to purchase needed supplies for his business and be able gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new parts, tools and fuel.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 24 years old. He is very energetic and has been in farming for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 37 years old. He is a father of four children. He has been a rice farmer for the past ten years.  With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. He plans to buy cows which will provide milk for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, blankets and bedcover sets wholesale.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo is 48 years old, married, and has two sons, a daughter-in-law, a retired father and two grandchildren. He lives in Mtskheta District. Karlo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family start-up business, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The source of income for the family is the small non-stable revenue earned by Karlo working as an auto mechanic, which is not enough to feed his large family.

Karlo is requesting a loan from Credo to start the family business and his loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions for the country's vulnerable poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Karlo will purchase calves to start an animal husbandry business. He will place cattle in a shed located in their yard, raise them, and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves and start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan is 41 and married. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has two dependent children to take care of; now, they are in school in the area. Raising rice and pigs is the primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for 10 years. Her husband helps to earn extra income by working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn approximately 15,000 KHR per day and save about 9,000 KHR each day for her family's future needs. 

This is the fourth microloan for Kan with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Kan, who is the leader, will use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 30 years old. He is engaged and he plans to get married soon. He has been a rice farmer for the past five years. Jean Claude is planning to request this loan to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy extra land for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 39-year-old single mother who has a family of 4 children she takes care of. She lives in the nearby locality that borders the main town. She deals in the bridal-wear business alongside catering services, a business she has done for the last 4 years. She says she realized the need to take on the business because her late husband had passed away and she needed something to keep the family running financially and materially.

She says she has managed to educate her 4 children, the eldest having completed a diploma in nursing, thanks to a Ugafode school-fees loan that has seen her children reach where they are. She says the 2 businesses have allowed her expand her home and also build a store where she keeps her bridal clothes and utensils.

She hopes to use the loan advanced to buy functional hire chairs that the locals can use for their weddings and different meetings. She says the business has had a stable rise because she enjoys a special monopoly in the locality.

However she comments on a challenge of small capital that at times makes her fail to meet the demand from the local society, since at times functions fall due on the same dates. She is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy chairs for function hire.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa lives close to Malava, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Kefa is married and has six children. Both him and his wife work on their land, and are currently growing bananas and sugarcane as well as working on a tree plantation, undertaking dairy farming, and operating a small fishery. Kefa likes beekeeping because “It’s cheap, and with Honey Care involved I am sure my hives will be well taken care of.” 

This is Kefa’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start a horticulture project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Branice

texts.en:
Branice lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Branice is married, and has six children. Her husband works in the local government, and holds the title of assistant chief for their area. Branice is engaged with projects on their land, and is currently growing maize, sugarcane and vegetables. Branice is excited to start beekeeping because it is not a time-consuming project, and it is easy to maintain.

This is Branice’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a small business and help pay her children’s school fees. Branice’s hope for the future is “to see my children through school and to be able to take care of my family comfortably.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Polycarp

texts.en:
Polycarp lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugarcane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Polycarp is married, and has one child. He is currently running a small business, growing maize, doing gardening of vegetables for market, and farming rice and sunflowers (which is an excellent food for bees). He is also in the process of increasing his education level through courses. Polycarp likes beekeeping because he believes that honey is a very good food with medicinal properties.

This is Polycarp’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in his small business. Polycarp’s dream for the future is to “finish my education, have a stable job and a happy family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rainforest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Rosemary is married, and has six children and several grandchildren. Her and her husband have been farming for thirty yeras, and are currently growing maize, groundnuts, bananas, sweet potatoes, and vegetables on their land. Rosemary is looking forward to starting to keep bees because it is “a profitable project.”

This is Rosemary’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to “take care of my grandchildren and educate them.” Her dream for the future is “to see my children having good jobs and I want to buy a car.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 59-year-old lady who lives in Nsambya, a Kampala City surburb, with two dependents who are her grandchildren. 

She operates a salon business which she has been improving from time to time and this has helped her to cater for her personal needs and school fees for her grandchildren. She believes that her salon will soon reach a standard that will attract more customers and make more profits.

 In light of this vision she wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more equipment for the salon so that she will be in position to deliver better services and make more profits. She is hard-working and believes she will achieve much with the Kiva partnership.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rodinson

texts.es:
Rodinson es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Robinson inicio sus estudios de Administración de Empresas, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos tuvo que suspenderlos, pero le gustaría poder retomarlos, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rodinson trabaja en su pequeño negocio de transporte urbano, el cuenta con dos autos, el cual uno de ellos alquila a otros choferes y el otro lo maneja él brindando servicios de transporte, Rodinson trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Rodinson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su vehículo, de esta manera podrá seguir brindando sus servicios y generará ingresos para su familia, así pues Rodinson seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rodinson is a 48 years old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and four children. He loves them and they are the main reason for living. He is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic, and he and his wife put forth all their efforts into bringing up the family.

Rodinson though his own efforts began his Business Administration studies, but unfortunately due to financial reasons had to stop, but he would like to start back again. In his free time he likes to share great moments with his family.

Through his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Rodinson works in his own small business of urban transport and he has two cars. One of them he rents to other drivers and he drives the other offering transportation services. Rodinson works every day from the early morning hours and does so for about ten hours.

Rodinson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the provided help he can make repairs and do the necessary general maintenance to his car so he can continue offering his services and earn income for his family. So Rodinson will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and general maintenance of his vehicle which he uses in his transport business

loans.name: Melissa Ysabel

texts.es:
Melissa es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Melissa se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Bioquímica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Melissa trabaja vendiendo productos naturales, como batidos, vitaminas y otros, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, Melissa se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Melissa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de productos naturales para su venta, de esta manera Melissa tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a más clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
20 year old Melissa is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona. She is a very likeable, hard-working and enthusiastic person, with a strong drive to improve herself. Thanks to her hard work and her parents' support, Melissa is currently studying for a professional career as a biochemist, which she has always wanted to do. In her spare time she likes to listen to music and sometimes makes a very tasty 'Arroz con Pollo' [a traditional chicken and rice dish] to share with the family. 

Acting on her own initiative and with great dedication, Melissa sells natural products such as milkshakes, vitamins and other items. She works every day from early in the morning and can work for around 6 hours. She enjoys her work and thinks it is going well because her prices are good and she treats her customers well. Melissa is very grateful to the lenders since she will be able to buy more products wholesale with the support she is getting. By doing this she will have a better-stocked business and will be able to serve more customers. In this way she will be able to carry on working hard to realise her big dream of becoming a true professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Flores desde hace 3 años, en este tiempo ha establecido muy buenos lasos de amistad con todas sus amigas, le gusta mucho el compañerismo, la solidaridad y el compromiso que tienen todos para salir adelante, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su centro histórico, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Gloria tiene 34 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijas de 17, 15, 12,10 años y su última hija de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus tres primeras hijas están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su penúltima hija esta estudiado en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión electricista, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Gloria trabaja todos los días como auxiliar de limpieza desde hace dos años y labora de lunes a viernes, en el tiempo de clases da servicio privado de transporte escolar a varios niños. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos para el arreglo de su vehículo. 

Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a part of the Las Flores credit group for three years.  In this time, she has established very good ties of friendship with all her friends.  She likes the friendship, solidarity, and the agreement that everyone has to succeed.  She lives in the city Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is surrounded by four rivers.  In December 1999, it was made a World Heritage Site for the beauty of its historic center.  The people still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  

Gloria is 34 years old, married, and has five daughters who are 17, 15, 12, and 10 years old, and her youngest is just 3 months old.  Her three oldest daughters are studying at a school in the city and her second to last daughter is studying at a primary school in the city.  Her husband is an electrician.  They do not own a house, so they rent.

Gloria has worked every day as a cleaning assistant for two years and works Monday to Friday. During the school year, she provides a private school transportation service for various children.  She will use this loan to purchase parts to repair her vehicle.  

Her goal is to purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is a youthful man of about 29 years living in Buyamba local area. He has a family of 3 kids that he looks after. He ventures in banana farming, a business he has done for the last 4 years. He couples it with motorcycle taxi riding for a daily income activity. He says he started boda boda to supplement the earnings from his plantation, that usually gives earnings after 2 weeks.

He says he managed to acquire the motorcycle through Ugafode asset acquisition loan, which has increased his incomes. He has also managed to buy a cow that has given him some milk to improve his household diet.

Recemtly he has managed to assemble some bricks which he hopes to use to put up a semi-permanent house to improve his household living. He hopes to use the facility extended to him to mulch his plantation, especially as it’s currently a dry spell, to avoid loss of soil water affecting his yields. He confesses a major challenge of destructive rains when they struck, destroying big chunks of the plantation, and the banana bacterial wilt.

loans.use: to buy mulches.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 24-year-old man who lives in the outskirts of a main town. He is married and has one child. Gerald is a businessman who operates a bar business. He also supplements his income with saloon and video library businesses. He started his bar business in 2011 and his aim was to generate income for sustaining his family. He sells his products to residents around his area.

His hopes are to expand his bar to a modern set up and allocate other branches in rural setting. He says he intends to use the loan acquired to buy more stock for his bar so as to attract more clients, who keep asking for more varieties of spirits that are new on market, but which he does not have.

His main challenge is lack of enough capital and refusal of clients to pay after getting drunk. He describes himself as a hard-working man and asks Ugafode to continue rendering their services to the local people.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Salamatu from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 15 years. Two of her children are attending school. She started this business because she dropped out of school at an early age and decided to run a business because she doesn’t want to be idle.  

Salamatu runs a provision shop; she sells milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise and drinks. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business seven days a week for twelve hours a day.  Salamatu says that the main challenge in her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise and drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise, drinks, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 4 and 19, who all go to school. She is a rice farmer and has been a rice farmer for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Utatlan Group

texts.en:
In the northwestern highlands of Guatemala is the department (state) of Santa Cruz del Quiche. This is one of the most important departments in terms of craft production. Here you will find women weaving and crafting embroidery on backstrap looms. 

Last year, a new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank was formed called Utatlan, and it is composed of 11 female entrepreneurs who own a variety of commerce businesses that range from textiles and clothing to medicine and cosmetics. Continued funding is pivotal for these women to obtain the financial capital needed to support and grow their businesses.  In addition, when receiving a microloan from Friendship Bridge, they also receive monthly educational lessons.

The current secretary of the Utatlan Trust Bank is Angelica. Angelica is 34 years old and married to a bricklayer assistant. Together they have four children, two of whom are currently enrolled in school. Angelica’s business is selling traditional and used clothing, which she sells door to door as well as from her home. Angelica’s business is doing well, thus she has decided to invest more capital into the business. 

Angelica successfully paid off her first loan and has now applied for a second loan. She is requesting a loan of approximately $320, which she will use to purchase additional merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her hope is that in the future she will be able to create a second business. To reach that goal she must grow her revenue from her commerce business and start saving. Her savings combined with Friendship Bridge microloans will help get her second business up and running.

She and her colleagues are very excited to be able to have access to funding they would not have without Kiva and Friendship Bridge. The women in the Utatlan Trust Bank enjoy the monthly educational lessons, which are an integral part of the Friendship Bridge model, where the women in the Trust Bank discuss topics related to business administration, budget, promotion, and different ways of do business (wholesale, retail, catalog, personal sales, etc.).

Angelica personally wants to thank Kiva investors for offering her access to financial capital, for their generosity, which has enabled her and her teammates to continue to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
Las Estrellas de Xenacoj (the Stars of Xenacoj) Trust Bank consists of eight women from Santo Domingo Xenacoj Guatemala. The women are on average 36 years old, and they are engaged in a range of activities such as: purchasing and selling traditional clothing, growing and selling agricultural products, selling snacks, and weaving Guatemalan textiles. Out of the eight women in the group, six never received any formal education, and only two have finished high school.

One of the farmers among the group is Anselma who is 34 years old and has four children (three boys and a girl). Although Anselma never went to school, she is a hard worker and has a strong desire to succeed and build a better future for her children. She and her husband have been farmers for several years, and currently cultivate 10 acres of land.
