Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elida trabaja como asistente en un estudio contable de su ciudad, ella labora todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Elida se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Elida se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de la parte trasera de su vivienda, ya que actualmente esta se encuentra desprotegida y al estar en la época de invierno, ella y sus padres están desprotegidos, de esta manera Elida brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio estudio contable.
texts.en:
Elida is a 40-year-old woman, she is single and lives with her parents in the city of Nazca. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into getting ahead in life. Through her efforts and the support of her parents, Elida was able to study a degree in Accountancy as she had wanted. In her free time, she likes to spend a bit of time reading and sometimes cook a delicious dish of Lomo Saltado (stir-fried beef) to share with her family.

Upon her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Elida works as an assistant in an accountancy firm in her city. She works every day from early on in the morning for approximately 8 hours. Elida feels at ease with her job and believes that it is going well thanks to her hard work and the friendly treatment she offers others.

Elida is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that she will be able to build the rear part of her home as it is currently unprotected and given that it is winter in Peru, Elida and her parents are unprotected. In this way, Elida will offer her family greater security and well-being, and in this manner she will continue working and making every effort to achieve her greatest dream of having her own accountancy firm.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 1, 2  & 3 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is the coordinator of her group, Creciendo Para el Futuro 1, 2, & 3 (Growing for the Future). Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She is a young single mother with a child. She works hard to pay her university fees and become a professional. Adriana also wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house. 

Having repaid her previous loans and grown her business, Adriana is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza. She cooks food and delivers it to people. She has been in this business for almost seven years. She plans to use this loan to buy goods, including rice, meat, vegetables, and beans. She will save part of the profit and use the remainder to provide for her child and home. 

In the near future, Adriana wants to build her own house. She dreams of becoming a professional and having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, and beans.

loans.name: La Buena Union 4 Group

texts.en:
Leonor is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión (The Good Union) 4” group. They are micro-entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

She lives in a simple home structure with her long-term partner. She says her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business and improve it; she wants to have a shoe store. From the beginning, it was very hard for her because she didn't have the capital for it.

Leonor is very excited about receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’ growth. She has had her business for about six years; she has been taking out loans from Esperanza for almost five years. 

She will use this new loan to buy shoes in different sizes and styles. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes in different styles and sizes.

loans.name: Sol Naciente De Los Olivos De Pro Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SOL NACIENTE DE LOS OLIVOS DE PRO” es una nueva alcancía, este es su primer ciclo, el grupo lo conforman  07 socios. María es una de las integrantes ella tiene 27 años y es la tesorera del grupo. María es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos pequeños, con su trabajo ayuda a su esposo para brindar a sus hijos estabilidad, son 03 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, por ahora solo entrega por pedidos, sus clientas le solicitan diferentes modelos que ella les vende a buenos precios, por ahora no tiene un lugar fijo donde vender, por lo mismo mas adelante desea alquilar un lugar donde poner su negocio, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar ropa para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes por entregar  y adquirir más modelos para vender. María está muy agradecida de que existan personas desinteresadas que invierten con personas como ella y su grupo comunal.
Maria es la quinta de la izquierda viste chompa color crema.
texts.en:
Sol Naciente de Los Olivos de Pro Group is a new communal bank.  This is their first loan cycle.  There are seven members.

María, 27, is one of the members and she's the treasurer of the bank.  She's married and has two small children.  With her job she helps her husband give their children stability.

María has sold clothing for three years.  Currently she only sells on order.  Her customers order different styles that she sells at good prices.  Currently she doesn't have a fixed location where she sells, for which reason she wants to rent a place to set up her business in the future.

With the loan she's requesting she'll be able to buy clothing to fill her pending orders and acquire more styles to sell.

María's very grateful that there are generous people who invest in people such as herself and her communal bank.  María's the fifth from the left; she's wearing a cream-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Talia Fernanda

texts.es:
Talia es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Talia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Talia trabaja en su pequeño de venta de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, realiza sus ventas en hogar y puede atender a un promedio de 15 clientes diarios, Talia cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Talia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir de temporada, como polos, buzos, pantalones, chompas y otros, de esta manera Talia seguirá trabajando y estudiando a fin de lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Talia is a 22-year-old woman, she is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a keen desire to better herself. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Talia is pursuing studies in Business Administration. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes cooks a delicious dish of Pollo Frito (fried chicken) to share with her family.

At her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Talia works in her small clothes business. She works every day from early in the morning, selling from her home and can attend on average 15 customers per day. Talia believes that it is going well thanks to the good prices and the friendly way she treats others.

Talia is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that she will be able to buy a larger volume and variety of seasonal clothes such as polo shirts, tracksuits, trousers, sweaters and so on. In this way Tallia will continue working and studying in order to achieve her greatest dream of becoming an excellent business woman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Rafael actualmente está soltero, su primer esposa le tiene dos hijos que dependen económicamente de él,  habita en casa de un familiar, continua trabajando para el estado desde hace 6 años, por medio del cual obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para asumir sus compromisos. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, piedrín y pago de mano de obra, para realizar una rampla en la vivienda donde habita, ya que el considera muy importante esta obra para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en: Rafael is currently single, his first wife has his two children who are financially dependent on him. He lives in a relative's home and continues to work for the State, as he has done for the last six years, through which he gains his monthly income to fulfill his commitments. He is seeking a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, stones and to pay for labor to build a ramp in the house he lives in as he believes that this work is very important for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and breeze blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish, soap, books, pans, oils and water

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene una niña de un año de edad.   Se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos desde muy corta edad, él recuerda que desde los  7 años  acompañaba a su padre  a realizar los trabajos agrícolas  quien con dedicación le enseño todo lo referente al trabajo  agrícola.

Los insumos agrícolas  los compra  en la ciudad,  ubicada a  15 minutos  trasladándolos  en pick up hasta su casa, desde su casa hasta  el área de siembra hay 1 kilómetro  y los insumos los traslada  a pie hasta el cultivo.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de 3 sacos de abono, 2 litros de insecticidas  y  el excedente  para el pago  de mano de  obra y cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. Con el préstamo se realizara  la compra de insumos agrícolas que permitirán  a la familia del cliente obtener mayor rendimiento  productivo;  lo cual generara excedentes  en  la producción  que les permitirá  obtener ingresos adicionales  a la hora de comercializar la producción y les  dará la oportunidad  de mejorar la dieta alimenticia  que tanto él  y su familia tengan  una buena  alimentación.

Los planes a futuro  del cliente es mantener el ritmo productivo  que a alcanzado  y diversificar la producción, con el fin de brindar mayores oportunidades de desarrollo a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old, is in a relationship, and has a one-year old daughter.  He has made his living planting basic grains from a very young age.  He remembers accompanying his father to do farming tasks since the age of 7 years.  His father took great care to teach him everything about agricultural work.

He buys the agricultural inputs in the city, which is located 15 minutes away, and transports them home in his pick-up.  His house is 1 km away from the farm, and he carries the inputs there on foot.

The loan will be used for the purchase of 3 sacks of fertilizer, 2 liters of insecticides, and the remainder for labor and to farm 21,000 square meters of corn and beans.

With the loan, the agricultural inputs will be purchased, which will allow the client's family to get greater yield.  This will generate production surpluses, which will allow them to get additional earnings when it is time to sell, and will give them the opportunity to improve their nutrition so that he and his family can have good diets.

The client's future plan is to maintain the productive rhythm that he has achieved and to diversify production, so that he can offer his family greater development opportunities.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of fertilizer, 2 liters of insecticides and use the remainder to pay for labor and to farm 21,000 square meters of corn and beans.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 30 years old, married and has seven children She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $70. She earns a good income from her business.

Angelina will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as water, soap, bread, fish, oils, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, books and pans. 

She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy water, soap, bread, fish, oils, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, books and pans.

loans.name: Inuk Ba Moris Group

texts.en:
Costantinha is one of the members of the “Inuk Ba Moris” Group. The words "Inuk Ba Moris" are in a local language and mean “hope".

Costantinha is taking the loan to add more to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies, such as petrol, onions and garlic. 

She is a hardworking woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $40.

loans.use: to buy petrol, onions and garlic.

loans.name: María Delfina

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Yanaturo Alto, le gusta esta forma de crédito ya que les dan la oportunidad de estrechar los lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, al mismo tiempo los créditos les permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica. Vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de la naturaleza,  es cuna de grandes artistas y artesanos, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos  de 21,19, 13, 8 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada privada desde hace 6 años, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar este negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su negocio propio como un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is applying for her third loan with her friends and colleagues of the Yanaturo Alto communal bank. She likes this type of loan as it is gives them the opportunities to strengthen her friendships with all of her colleagues. At the same time, the loans enable them to improve their financial stability. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a city that is renowned for nature. The city is the birthplace of great artists and craftsmen, and the people still maintain their town's culture and traditions.

María is 39 years old, she is married and from her marriage she had five children aged 21,19, 13, 8 and 7 years old. Her eldest son is studying at university, her second daughter is married and lives independently, her third son is studying at college and her two youngest children are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own home which is why they are renting.

María takes care of the household chores and has been working for the last six years from Monday to Friday as a private sector employee. She also rears chicken for a living. These activities allow her to contribute to the household's finances.

She will invest the money in this loan in the purchase of poultry to grow this business. María's dream is to have her own business such as a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Olga   tiene 51 años tiene dos hijos,  ella se dedica  a la   venta  de variedad de Calzados, para cholitas, tiene su puesto de venta en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, La Sra. Olga   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados de cuero por mayor y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Olga   va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de mercadería,    es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder ofrecer sus productos por mayor a distintos mercados  y ferias de los distintos departamentos a nivel Nacional.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old and has two children.  She makes her living selling a variety of footwear to indigenous rural women.  She has her sales stall in a very trafficked area of the city of La Paz.

This loan is her first with the institution.  Olga is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale leather footwear, so that she can offer a variety of footwear to her clientele.  The reason she is applying for this loan is to continue improving her business.  Olga is going to use the proceeds to continue buying a variety of merchandise.  

She is a very hardworking person and is happy for this opportunity.  Her desire is to be able to offer her wholesale products at various markets and fairs in the different departments at a national level.

loans.use: to buy wholesale leather footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy food ingredients and furniture for restaurant business

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es: La señora Adelfa  tiene 54 tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas, frazadas, y otros artículos, ella ofrece sus productos a distintas oficinas, domicilios a crédito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La señora Adelfa  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de mercadería variada como edredones por mayor ya que  esta época tiene mucha demanda y ella desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, La señora Adelfa  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Adelfa is 54 years old and has two children. She works selling a variety of quilts, sheets, blankets and other items.  She sells her products at different offices and homes on credit.  This loan is her first with the organization.  Adelfa will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise, such as quilts, wholesale.  There is a lot of demand for her products at this time, and she wants to supply her business.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she received several orders and did not have enough capital to obtain the products.   The challenges that Adelfa is experiencing in her business are competition and the current high demand, and she will use her loan proceeds to increase her merchandise and thus her sales.

loans.use: to buy quilts wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite and Sagiko), milks, fish, soap, books, pans, salt, eggs, oils and other items

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is taking a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

Filomena will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, salt, sugar, oils and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of USD 200. Filomena is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, salt, sugar and oils

loans.name: Margarita Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su hija y su esposo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Doña Margarita su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad,  necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, que es la materia prisma que necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto.
Doña Margarita espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado su calidad de vida y en el de  familia.
Doña Margarita espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hija continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Margarita is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her daughter and husband in a community in southern Honduras. She makes and sells tortillas for a living.

Margarita's business is very well-known in her community. She needs the loan so that she can buy corn, lime, and firewood, the raw materials that she needs in order to make her product.

Margarita hopes that, thanks to this loan, she will have the necessary supplies to continue doing business and meet her customers' demand. She hopes that her sales will increase considerably, which will be reflected in her and her family's quality of life.

Margarita hopes that her business will continue to grow and will become the most well-known in the community so that she can continue supporting her family, her daughter can continue with her studies, and they will have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La señora Ana, habitante del departamento de Juigalpa, habita en casa de su mamá, es casada, trabaja desde hace 15 años en un súper mercado, con sus ingresos mantiene a sus dos hijos pequeños quienes van a la escuela. Ana solicita este crédito para comprar laminas de zinc y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo en dos cuartos donde habita, ya que están en malas condiciones y con las lluvias se le moja las cosas, por lo que es necesario realizar esta obra para vivir en mejores condiciones con sus hijos y la familia.
texts.en: Ana lives in the department of Juigalpa. She lives in her mother's house, is married and has worked in a supermarket for the last 15 years. She cares for her two small children who go to school. Ana is requesting this loan to buy zinc sheets and to pay for the manual labor necessary to change the roof in two rooms where she lives; it's in poor condition, and with the rains everything gets wet. This renovation is necessary in order to improve living conditions for her children and the family.

loans.use: buy sheets of zinc and purlin beams.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  María  es  una persona  emprendedora  honesta, seria y muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en  la  zona sur  de Honduras. Su  negocio es la venta de pan, los cuales elabora en su casa.
Doña María  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  varias  cajas de manteca, azúcar, soda,  harina y leche  ya  que en su zona este producto se comercializa mucho y tiene muchos clientes. 
Doña María  espera que con la inversión que realice las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más variedad de pan para  ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco su situación  económica  y la de su familia. 
 Doña María  espera que su negocio  siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia, para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  con principios y valores.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del   2013
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising, honest, serious and very hardworking person.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling bread, which she makes in her home.  Maria needs this loan to buy several cases of butter, sugar, baking soda, flour and milk, because sales of her product are high in this region and she has many customers. Maria hopes that with this investment her sales will increase, as she will be able to offer a greater variety of bread to her customers, so as to meet their needs and to improve the economic circumstances for her and her family. Maria hopes that her business will continue to grow and consolidate so that it will become larger and well-known in the area, and that it will continue to support her family so that her children will complete their education and become honest people with principles and values. 
 
Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy butter, sugar, baking soda, flour and milk for her business.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Doña Mariana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es  la venta de carnes desde hace 25 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad.
Doña Mariana necesita el préstamo para la compra de más  reces y cerdos para destace, que necesita para seguir desarrollando su negocio. Ella espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con las reces y cerdos necesarios para seguir desarrollando su  actividad y así mismo que sus ventas tengan un aumento en el negocio y con esto ganar más ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar un poco su estilo de vida  y el de su familia.
Doña Mariana espera hacer crecer su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia para que sus hijos continúen con los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Mariana is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and their 3 children. For the past 25 years, she has made a living by selling meat in her community.

Mariana needs the loan to buy more cows and pigs to butcher so that she can continue to develop her business. She hopes that the loan will help her a lot since she does not currently have the cows and pigs that she needs to continue with her business. She also hopes that her sales will increase, providing her with more income that will help her improve her and her family's quality of life.

Mariana hopes to grow her business and continue supporting her family so that her children can continue studying and can become good people with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy cows and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor José Alfredo es una persona responsable  y trabajadora que vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, vive con su esposa e hijos. 
Don José Alfredo su negocio es una pulpería la cual le a ayuda a salir adelante, vende productos como ser refresco, manteca, plátano, pollo, condimentos, pan, carnes. 
Don José Alfredo sus clientes son las personas que lo visitan frecuentemente en la comunidad  y demás personas de  la zona. En su negocio le ayudan su esposa  e  hijos  ya que su negocio es muy visitado por los clientes. Necesita el préstamo para poder comprar refrescos, aguas, leches, azúcar, frijoles, café, pan,  quesos, manteca, plátanos, etc.  para su pulpería  porque  con el dinero que cuenta ahora no es le es suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes,  espera que esta inversión le ayude aumentar su nivel de ventas para poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y ayudar a su familia para salir adelante.       



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
José Alfredo is a responsible, hard-working person who lives in a community south of Honduras. He lives with his wife and children. José Alfredo owns a grocery store business, which helps him get ahead. He sells products, like refreshments, butter, bananas, chicken, condiments, bread and meats. José Alfredo's clients are those people in the community who visit him frequently and others in the area. He has lots of clients, so his wife and children help him with the business. He needs the loan to buy refreshments, water, milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, cheeses, butter, bananas, etc., for his store because he lacks the resources to satisfy his clients' needs. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales so he can improve his quality of life and help his family get ahead.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy refreshments, water, milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, cheeses, butter, bananas, etc., for his store.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es:
La señora  Marísel  es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y   honesta,  que vive  con  su  esposo e hijos  en la zona sur de Honduras. Ella se dedica a la fábrica  de pan desde hace más de 12 años. 
Doña Marisel con  el   crédito   espera   poder comprar soda, leche, huevos, harina, etc.  que es toda  la  materia  prima   necesaria  para la elaboración del pan  y así cumplir con los  pedidos de sus clientes ya  que son muchos.
Doña Marisel  el producto que tiene en  este  momento  no es la suficiente para satisfacer todas las demandas y ella  no quiere perder su clientela por falta de producto. También  espera  elevar  su  nivel  de ventas  por lo tanto  tener mejores ingresos y mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y al mismo tiempo apoyar a su familia.        	



Choluteca, Honduras  – Julio  del   2013
texts.en:
Marísel is a very responsible, hardworking, and honest person. She lives with her husband and children in southern Honduras. For more than 12 years, she has made a living by making bread.

With the loan, Marísel hopes to be able to buy baking soda, milk, eggs, flour, etc., which are all the raw materials that she needs to make bread. This way, she will be able to fill her customers' many orders.

Marísel does not currently have the necessary supplies to meet her customers' demands, and she doesn't want to lose clients because she does not have enough products. She also wants to increase her sales so that she will have more income and can improve her and her family's quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras  – July 2013

loans.use: to buy baking soda, milk, eggs, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elizita

texts.en:
A loan of USD 1,000 is offered to Elizita to improve her business. Elizita opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own effort. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like rice, noodles, oils, bread and fish. 

Elizita is generating a good income from sales. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in the business.  Elizita is living in a town with her family, and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, oils, bread and fish

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
Margarida is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking of how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. 

Margarida will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as rice, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, hard drinks (beer), bread and ice. She is happy with Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) for offering loans to poor people. She has a house that is so simple, so she was happy because of the assistance from TRM. Receiving credit helps her to live a life that is good for the whole family. She can measure how she benefits from the sale at her kiosk.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, hard drinks (beer), bread and ice

loans.name: Dame Domin Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is one the members from Dame Domin Group. The phrase "Dame Domin" is in a local language and means "Hope."

Aurelia is taking the loan to add to her own working capital in order to buy additional inventory such as coffee, sugar, salt, fish and noodles. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $70.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, fish and noodles

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
La señora  María es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y   honesta,  que vive  con  su  esposo e hijos  en la zona sur de Honduras. Ella se dedica a la venta de sandias en Choluteca y sectores aledaños. 
Doña María con  el   crédito   espera   poder comprar   toda  la  mercadería   necesaria  para  cumplir con los  pedidos de sus clientes ya  que son muchos  y la mercadería que tiene en  este  momento  no es la suficiente para satisfacer todas las demandas y ella  no quiere perder su clientela por falta de producto. 
Doña María también  espera  elevar  su  nivel  de ventas  por lo tanto  tener mejores ingresos y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y el de su familia y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos para darles un futuro mejor.




Choluteca, Honduras  – Julio  del   2013
texts.en: Maria is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person.  She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras.  She works selling watermelons in Choluteca and in surrounding areas.  With this loan Maria hopes to be able to buy enough merchandise to fill her customers' numerous orders.  The amount of merchandise that she currently has is not enough to meet all of the demand, and she does not want to lose customers due to a lack of product.  Maria would also like to increase her sales, so as to have more income and to improve her family's quality of life a bit, and to continue supporting her children to give them a better future. Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy watermelons for her business.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is a 40-year-old woman from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 (Thirty Thousand Rwandan Francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Wilhelmina started selling lights in May, 2013 and she has sold 140 lights to date, providing clean energy to 700 people. 

She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eduardo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cordero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eduardo como operario en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, él realiza labores de mantenimiento de cultivos y otros, Eduardo trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su un desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eduardo se siente muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal de segunda mano, ya que Eduardo vive en una zona muy alejada de su trabajo, de esta manera él espera poder ahorrar un poco de dinero de movilidad, el cual desea ahorrar para poder lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 23-year-old man, he is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with his parents and his siblings. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who has a keen desire to better himself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because of the need to work from a young age, he was unable to study Mechanical Engineering as he had wanted. In his free time, Eduardo likes playing football with his friends and sometimes he cooks a delicious dish of Seco de Cordero (lamb stew) to share with his family.

At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Eduardo works as an operative in a farming company in his city. He carries out crop maintenance among other jobs. Eduardo works every day from early in the morning, and can do so for approximately 10 hours. He feels comfortable with the work he performs and believes that it is going well thanks to his hard work and the friendly way he treats others.

Eduardo is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to buy a second hand lightweight commuter motorbike as Eduardo lives very far away from his workplace. In this manner, Eduardo hopes to be able to save a bit of money in commuting. He wants to save to be able to achieve his greatest dream of pursuing studies in a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand lightweight commuter motorbike.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is a 69-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 (Thirty Thousand Rwandan Francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Erastus started selling lights in November 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ritza

texts.es:
La  señora  Ritza   es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos  en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de  sandias. Esta actividad la realiza en diversas  zonas de Choluteca donde su  producto es muy  exigido. 
Doña Ritza con el préstamo espera comprar más sandias para tener  producto y cubrir todos los pedidos que realizan sus clientes ya que  por ahora no  tiene  el  producto necesario para hacerlo porque en este momento no cuenta con el  dinero suficiente.
Doña Ritza cómo resultado espera el aumento de sus ventas y que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde las  ganancias necesarias para  que su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejore un poco y así enviar  a sus hijos a estudiar para que terminen sus estudios y tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
 



Choluteca, Honduras  –  julio   del   2013
texts.en:
Ritza is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. She lives with her children in southern Honduras. She sells watermelons for a living. She sells them in various zones of Choluteca, where her products are in high demand.

With this loan, Ritza hopes to buy more watermelons so that she will have enough products and be able to fill all of the orders that her customers have made. She does not currently have enough products since she does not have enough money.

Ritza hopes to increase her sales and continue growing her business so that she can earn the income necessary to improve her and her family's quality of life so that she can send her children to school to finish their studies so they will have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  July 2013

loans.use: to buy watermelons for her business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jose no pudo culminar sus estudios profesionales para convertirse en profesor, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose trabaja como ayudante en una panadería de su ciudad, el prepara panes, dulces y se encarga del horno, Jose trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para comprar materiales de construcción, los cuales utilizará para hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso en su vivienda, de esta manera Jose brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así pues Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jose is a 42-year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and their three children who he lives and are his driving force in life. Jose is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all their efforts into getting their family ahead in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work from a young age, Jose was unable to finish his university studies to become a teacher. In his free time, he likes playing with his children and he sometimes cooks a delicious dish of Frejoles con Seco to share with his family. 

At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Jose works as a bakery assistant in his city. He prepares bread, cakes and takes care of the oven. Jose works every day from the early hours of the morning and can do so for approximately 10 hours. He feels content in his job and believes that it is going well thanks to his excellent performance and the friendly way he treats others. 

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to cover the costs of buying construction materials which he will use to plaster, paint and lay the floor in his home and in this way offer greater security and well-being to his family. Jose will continue working and many every effort to achieve his greatest dream of seeing his children become upstanding professionals.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Frodouard

texts.en:
Frodouard is a 46-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.

Frodouard started selling lights in May 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is a 49 year old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of thirty thousand Francs (RWF 30,000) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Simeon started selling lights in May, 2012. He has sold 220 lights to date, providing clean energy to 1,100 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife .

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a 44-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean Damascene started selling lights in May 2012 and he has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Eraste

texts.en:
Eraste is a 46-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Eraste started selling lights in May 2012 and he has sold 140 lights to date, providing clean energy to 700 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa, es habitante de la ciudad de Juigalpa, vive junto a sus dos hijas  mayores de edad quienes le ayudan con su pequeño negocio y tres niños menores de edad que son nietecitos. Doña Teresa garantiza la alimentación de su humilde familia, con su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras, lo tiene establecido en el Ayote, comunidad cerca de Juigalpa, ella viaja los días jueves hasta el domingo a esa zona y sus comarcas para vender, donde tiene sus clientes establecidos. Solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como piedrín, piedras canteras, cemento hierro, bloques. Para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto donde habita, ya que los niños van creciendo y necesitan mayor privacidad, por lo que su meta es darle mejores condiciones de vida a su querida familia.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in Juigalpa with her two older children, who help with her small business, and her three young grandchildren. 

Teresa supplies food for her family with her small business in which she sells vegetables. Her business is located in Ayote, a community near Juigalpa. She travels each Thursday through Sunday to this area, where she has established customers, to sell her products.

She requests this loan to buy construction materials, like gravel, limestone blocks, cement, iron, and blocks to begin construction on a room in her house, since the children are growing and need more privacy. Her goal is to provide a better quality of life for her dear family.

loans.use: to buy gravel, limestone blocks, cement, iron, and blocks.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis, a 37-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda, is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.

Alexis started selling lights in September, 2012, and he has sold 20 to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is a 50-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Pierre started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a 26-year-old woman from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Valentine started selling lights in October 2012 and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband and their children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Emérita

texts.es:
Doña Emérita es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado pequeño alejado del bullicio de la ciudad ubicado al occidente del departamento de León.
Es una señora muy alegre y dinámica, a pesar de su edad refleja un espíritu emprendedor y motivador que les transmite a sus pequeños niños a los cuales les imparte clases de primaria.
Tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a la labor de maestra profesión que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijas y mejorar su vivienda.
En la actualidad presenta un problema en sus dientes trabajo que le cuesta mucho dinero y que no puede cubrir con su pequeño salario.
Por tal motivo se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento a los inversionistas de Kiva para realizarse este trabajo dental y mejorar su dentadura.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón que apoyan al más necesitado aprueben su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión donde les quedará muy agradecida por este apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Emérita lives in El Sauce, a small town far from the noise of the city, located in the eastern part of the León department.

She is a happy and dynamic woman. Despite her age, she has an entrepreneurial and motivating spirit, which she passes on to the young children whom she teaches in primary school. She has been teaching for more than 20 years, which has allowed her to move her family forward and improve her home. 

She currently has a dental problem that will cost a lot of money to fix. She cannot afford it with her small salary. For this reason, she came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan from Kiva lenders to receive dental work and improve her teeth.

She hopes and prays to God that the kindhearted people that support those who need it most will approve her loan, and she is very grateful for this unconditional support.

loans.use: to receive dental work.

loans.name: Samd

texts.en:
Samd, who lives in Sana`a, is a 28-year-old married father of one child. A joyful man who is full of life, he has faced financial problems. He is a soldier who works hard to improve his living standards. However, his salary is not enough to cover what he needs, He likes his job because it allows him to stay physically active and at the same time generate income to cover his home expenses.

Samd intends to buy a taxi and so has applied for a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy one. This will increase his income so that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a taxi to increase his income

loans.name: Maa Hingulai Self Help Group

texts.en: Maa Hingulai Self Help Group consists of 10 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm. They work together to improve their lives. One of them is Banita who was selected as their president. Banita is a 22-year-old lady living with her husband and her only child. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a variety shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, grains, lentils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. Banita has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to meet her customers' demand. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables. Banita, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 1,00,000 INR

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables for her shop.

loans.name: Radhakanta Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2009, 10 women from a small village in Odisha stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Radhakanta Self Help Group. The members of Radhakanta Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Lilabati, who was selected as their president. Lilabati is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, lady fingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more seeds, vegetable plants, fertilizers, and pesticides to increase her production and grow vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested for a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito Yanaturo Alto. Vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de la naturaleza, es cuna de grandes artistas y artesanos, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por las charlas de educación que reciben, la amistad que se afianza en cada reunión y la solidaridad.

La Señora Carmen tiene 32 años, es  casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es un profesional en la carpintería y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Carmen pasa en casa al cuidado de su familia pero aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa desde hace 10 años, ofrece su mercadería de casa en casa de lunes a viernes, los días que no se dedica a esta tarea ayuda en el taller de su esposo. 

Su nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa para incrementar su mercadería. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is seeking her fourth loan with the Yanaturo Alto communal bank. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a city renowned for the beauty of its countryside, and birthplace of great artists and craftsmen. Its people still maintain the city's culture and traditions. Carmen likes her communal bank because of the educational talks they receive, the friendships that are strengthened at each meeting, and the feeling of solidarity.

Carmen is 32 years old, she is married and the fruit of this marriage is two children aged 12 and 14 who are studying at a high school in the city. Her husband is a carpenter and works in his own workshop. The house in which she lives is her own.

Carmen spends her time at home looking after the family, but to contribute to the household finances, she has also been selling clothes as a door-to-door salesperson. She displays her merchandise from Monday to Friday, the days in which she doesn't work selling clothes, she helps in her husband's workshop.

Her new loan is to buy clothes to increase her merchandise. Her dream is to run a boutique in her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Franklin Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Franklin es una persona emprendedora, honesta, seria y trabajadora, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos  en la  zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Don Franklin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  más  reses ya que se las están dando a un buen precio.  Con esta inversión que realice  espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco su situación  económica y la de su  familia.
Don Franklin   espera que  en unos 2 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas con principios y valores.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del   2013
texts.en:
Franklin is enterprising, honest, serious and hard working. He lives with his wife and 3 children in the south of Honduras. His business is buying and selling cattle. 

Franklin needs this loan to buy more cattle, as they're selling at a good price. With this investment, he hopes his business sales increase, as he can offer more to his clients and cover their needs, and that way improve his and his family's economic situation. 

Franklin hopes that in the next 2 years, his business will continue growing and consolidating so it can turn into the largest and most well-known in the area. He also hopes to continue supporting his family so that his children finish their studies and become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Doña Nohemy es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, vive con esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 7 años, los cuales vende en la comunidad donde vive. 
Doña Nohemy necesita el préstamo para la compra de mínimos, mangos, melones, sandias, piñas, manzanas etc. y poder abastecer su negocio de frutas y seguir desarrollando esta actividad y lograr  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar así un poco su nivel de vida.
Doña Nohemy espera que su negocio crezca y poder enviar a sus hijos a estudiar, ella espera que el préstamo le sirva mucho, su sueño es que sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Nohemy is a very responsible and hardworking person.  She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and 3 children.  Her business for the past 7 years has been selling fruit in the community where she lives.   Nohemy needs this loan to buy bananas, mangos, melons, watermelons, pineapples, apples, etc. to supply her business with fruit and continue growing the business, and thus to increase her income and improve her standard of living a bit.  Nohemy hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to send her children to get an education.  She hopes that the loan will be very useful.  Her dream is that her children will become good people with principles and values.
Choluteca, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangos, melons, watermelons, pineapples, apples, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Annapurna Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mamata is 32 years old and married. She lives in a village in the Khurda district with her husband and her two children. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for five years, she manages to earn about 3,000 INR per month.

This is a group loan for Mamata's group of 12 women named Annapurna Self Help Group. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Mamata wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to better her living conditions. The members of the group Annapurna Self Help Group are very ambitious and are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, retail stores, vegetable selling etc.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Alicia Y Helen Group

texts.es:
DÚO SOLIDARIO ALICIA Y HELEN 
La señora Alicia de 52 años de edad, lleva 15 años en su tienda, y está muy contenta por el negocio que Dios le ha regalado. A pesar de que su negocio está ubicado en uno de los callejones del lugar donde vive siempre  llegan las personas a comprar a su tienda.   Actualmente tiene mucho pedido de aguas gaseosas y no tiene lo suficiente en la tienda, le están pidiendo gaseosas en lata, desechables, litros, jumbos, gaseosas normales y también le hace falta azúcar, arroz, y algunos otros granos, también un poco de medicina ya que tambien a empesado a vender medicina como pastillas de acetaminofen, panadol, tabcin y otros. entonces El dinero no le alcanza y necesita tener los artículos en la tienda para que sus clientes no se vallan por ello hace un nuevo préstamo para comprar todo lo que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Alicia and Helen Solidarity Group

Sra. Alicia is 52 years old and has been managing a store for 15 years. She is very pleased with this business that God has given her. Even though her business is located along one of the alleyways in the town where she lives, there are always people who come to her store to buy. She currently gets many requests for water and sodas, but she does not have sufficient stock in her store. Her customers ask for sodas in cans and disposable containers, both in the jumbo and normal sizes. Alicia is also lacking in sugar, rice, and a few other basic staples. She has started to sell medicines such as acetaminophen tablets, panadol, tabcin, and other remedies, but she has very little in stock.

Alicia does not have enough money, but needs to have the products in her store so that her customers will not go elsewhere. For this reason, she will use her new loan to buy everything that she is lacking.

loans.use: to buy everyday consumer products and medicines to sell in her store.

loans.name: Los Cardamomeros Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es madre soltera, de edad 28 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estuidar, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando, se dedica a la siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio con sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para limpia de cardamomo, desea en el futuro que su negocio prospere para poder mantener de mejor manera a sus hijos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la cosecha de cardamomo.
 En la fotografia estan 19 integrantes, pero, solo a 10 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 28, is a single mother.  She didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  She has three children, all of whom are in school.

Rosa makes a living growing cardamom.  She started this business with her parents and currently has 10 years of experience.  She has the support of her family.

She decided to organize a group and is requesting a loan to weed her cardamom.  She wants her business to prosper in the future so she can better support her children.

The other members of the group make their livings harvesting cardamom.  There are 19 members in the photo but only 10 of them were given the loan.

loans.use: to pay for weeding her cardamom
